review.title: Clean, reasonably priced hotel near airport.
review.reviewText: Chose hotel for its location and shuttle service to the San Francisco Airport. It is an older hotel but had clean comfortable beds and a fairly large room.   We also ate at a restaurant nearby and enjoyed a walk along the waterfront walkway beside the hotel. The shuttle bus to the airport worked perfectly for us and although we didn't have time for breakfast, the choices they had laid out were the best out of all the hotels we had stayed at.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, free airport shuttle and beds.  Good looking free breakfast.  We were also able to print off our boarding passes at the front desk.
review.negativeRemarks: Could use newer dressers and carpeting in the room.   The elevator wasn't working the day we were there.  Help was offered to carry luggage to 2nd fl.
review.locationRemarks: Mainly an area of hotels and restaurants. If we had had a car or more time there was a mall nearby.  It was about a half hour to San Francisco.

review.title: Met all my needs
review.reviewText: Shuttle picked me up at the airport very quickly and the staff working at 10pm was friendly. Nice room and a great view of the bay. Very comfortable bed and very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Morning staff was friendly if you spoke first.
review.locationRemarks: near airport and the shuttle is very regular, when you get to the BART you can go anywhere

review.title: Worst hotel

review.positiveRemarks: Good price for what you get.
review.negativeRemarks: TV was not working, pillows uncomfortable.

review.title: A hotel I would not return to or recommend
review.reviewText: I held a room for a RE conference with a friend with two queen size beds.  I asked for a view and a no smoking room.  When we were done with the class and very tired we got to the hotel, the only room available for us was no view, one king size bed and the room smelled so badly of smoke we had to get the window opened, no screens, and on the stair case and try to get the smell out as one of the attendees was asthmatic.   We tried to get another room and were told they were out of rooms.   Not one of the items requested in the reservation were achieved.  We continued to go to bed and noted the bottom of our feet were jet black.  Then we noticed it was the dirt from the carpet.  I have never had this happen to me in a hotel with a cost of 200.   I was very embarrassed and disappointed in the whole experience and I will spend the extra 30 dollars and stay at the hotel that was having the seminar next time.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness, and attention to detail

review.title: Way Overpriced for the quality
review.reviewText:
The room was outdated with banged up furniture and holes in the walls where
Things used to hang. Smelled stale and strange odor in the room. You cannot control the air from the room, apparently it's all central air and all you can do is turn on the fan. If you like to leave a bathroom light on for night trips to the bathroom, forget it...all the lights are on timers that auto turn off except the two next to the bed. The bed was comfortable. The night staff was very friendly, Day staff not so much. The rooms are outside entrance. The hotel has three Stories and no elevator, so you have to lug your luggage up and down outdoor stairs if you're  on upper floors. Parking is limited, if the hotel is full you may not find a place to park in their parking lot. I overheard people complaining about that when I was searching for ice. Thin walls, noisy, woke up early to the intense smell of bacon, which I guess would be okay if I wasn't a vegatarian. I will not stay here again. It's a overpriced no frills outdated hotel that charges you for the proximity to the airport. If I hadn't been exhausted from my flight I wouldn't have stayed there.
review.positiveRemarks: Bed was acceptable. Proximity to airport. Night staff was very friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Lower price. Update rooms. Fix holes in walls and clean vents in ceilings. Paint over ceiling tile stains or replace them.
review.locationRemarks: Close to SFO

review.title: couldn't call into the hotel; no phone service
review.reviewText: No rooms were ready when we arrived from the airport at 1p. Neither I, nor Expedia, could contact the hotel prior to arrival as the phones were not working. No air conditioning, low end hotel.  Would not stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: See above
review.locationRemarks: N/A as I was in San Francisco for business.

review.title: Location was Great, but....
review.reviewText:
Negatives:  the first night while I was sleeping the heater kicked on, I can't sleep well in the heat and even though I managed to get it turned off  there was no air-conditioning to counter it's effects.  My ground floor room offered little privacy unless my blackout shades were drawn.  It was often noisy and I didn't feel safe leaving my window open while I slept.

Positives:  The location is awesome!  A beautiful paved bayside trail is steps away - great for walks and plane watching.  Two great restaurants are right next door - Elephant Bar and El Torito.  The hot breakfast served each morning was nice.

review.title: Decent place to put your feet up
review.reviewText:
Very standard hotel with all the minimal amenities provided. Don't expect to be wow. This is a place to go to for a clean room for a night or two near SFO airport. The free breakfast is a huge plus for those that don't want to hassle with looking for food if they have an early morning flight.

The room had clean sheets, floors and bathroom. My biggest complaint was the noisy overhead vent in the bathroom that you CAN NOT turn off. I also had to pull the plug from the in-room refrigerator as it was nearing it's end of life and was making very loud sounds each time the condenser turned on. It was absolutely impossible to sleep with the refrigerator on. The vent was manageable with the bathroom door closed. Lastly, you can hear the planes taking off and landing as the hotel is directly across the lake from SFO air strips. Have caution if you are a light sleeper.

I have a feeling rooms on the bay side are noisier (airport) but the bay is super pretty, I walked over and enjoyed the sunrise. 

There is an airport shuttle that goes to and from the airport. It's not super convenient FROM the airport (and a cab ride will still cost close to $15 after all the airport fees) but it's very convenient to the airport.

In fact my only complaint was that the room wasn't cleaned super well. A lot of very long black hair in the washroom and shower, kinda hard to miss. 

Probably would stay again if it was priced similarly and I needed to crash near the airport!

Lots of more expensive properties in the area, but this is definitely a good value if you just need a place to stay.  The exterior hallways allow for some noise due to other guests going to/from their rooms, but I was still able to get a good sleep.  Breakfast in the morning is good, but the seating area is small.  Outdoor tables available during good weather.  I would stay here again!

2nd stay by choice

Ice machines did not work for the 5 days we were there.
And I left my cell phone in the room, which seems to be now missing.  Housekeeping states they checked the room several times and could not find it. I guess I would have to believe that.

review.title: Great for air travelers
review.reviewText: Very close to SF airport, 5-minutes to rental car return, with gas station nearby.  Elephant Bar right next door, nice place to walk to and eat.  Small refrigerator.  Basic room is small and furniture a bit beat-up, but OK if you're just looking for a place to stay until your flight leaves.  Some rooms (I'm guessing more expensive) overlook the water and airstrips for a nice view, and the noise is not a problem.  Facility air conditioning mode is determined by the office, either cool or heat, but not both.  Very nice complementary self-serve breakfast in a small area with waffles, eggs, etc., but get there early before the bacon's gone!  Service was not particularly friendly, but helpful.  The managers would do well to get the carpet cleaned.  Got our socks dirty just by walking on it.  Overall good deal for traveler convenience.  If I lived in San Francisco, I would spend the night at the Vagabond just to avoid the morning traffic to the airport.
review.positiveRemarks: location near airport, breakfast, price, convenience to gas and restaurant, elevator for getting baggage to upper two floors
review.negativeRemarks: carpet cleanliness, maybe two chairs in a room, touch-up on dinged furniture
review.locationRemarks: Elephant Bar next door.  Did not explore any other possibilities.

review.title: Nice hotel by the bay
review.reviewText: It is a cosy hotel with a comfortable bed. It is just beside the bay and it is quite wonderful to catch the morning sunrise along the bay within 1 minute walking distance from the hotel.
Great place to stay on our last night. It was very clean, comfortable and close to the airport.
review.positiveRemarks: It was on the bay and you could watch planes landing and taking off without the noise.
review.negativeRemarks: People above us were a bit noisy but that can't be helped.

review.title: Easy access, Nice location
review.reviewText: The hotel is older but comfortable. Very easy access to highway with alternate driving routes should there be accidents between you and the airport. I would have enjoyed the more expensive "View" room better from an upper level balcony. The main floor sliding glass door opens to a sidewalk along the waterfront. No "Beach Access", but it is on the beach in the bay. Great view of the bay and Airport runways without the noise. It was very popular with the flight crews and pilots, too.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice Breakfast with ample seating on patio.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms could be updated.
review.locationRemarks: VERY CLOSE to the Airport. EASY access to HWY 101 and the coast is only an hour away.

review.title: Old and dated
review.reviewText: This hotel is old and shows its age.  Outside corridors, fairly shabby rooms.  The pluses are the location--right on the bay, and very helpful staff.

This is an overpriced flophouse that's water-adjacent. I felt like I was on the run. 

The furniture looked water damaged like it had been salvaged off a street corner. The large window meant that if I wanted any privacy, I had to skulk in darkness. All night long I heard loud traffic and slamming car/hotel doors along with a few alarms. I barely slept and would have preferred to have had a firearm within easy reach. 

The staff was very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Nice and safe place to stay
review.reviewText: great place to stay, near restaurant clean and safe environment, view to the bay,

review.title: Good price, close to airport
review.reviewText: We stayed here the night before our flight. Our room was cozy and I have no complaints, except for the vending. All I wanted was a water when I woke up. I went to the vending and the machine with waters wasn't accepting my money, so I tried getting a vitamin water out of the one next to it and a Gatorade comes out instead. But everything else was great. It was nice staying in a place that has washer and dryers so we could wash our dirty clothes and the free shuttle to the airport was very convenient.

review.title: Just an OK Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel got the job done for us - one night stay by the airport. There aren't many close places around to eat, so we ate before arriving at the hotel. The airport shuttle comes every 30 minutes and takes about 15 minutes to get to the airport. The breakfast was standard, but coffee was awful (but you can't expect good coffee at a hotel). This is not an indoor hotel but we felt safe.

review.title: Save your money
review.reviewText:
We found mosquitos and Flys in the room, no AC available, comforter dirty, "people" hanging around, loud and overall just not worth the money with so many nice places within a few blocks. 
We left at 3:30am.
Not a great experience! !!!

review.title: Convenient to the airport
review.reviewText: This is an ideal place to stay if you need somewhere close to the airport. It doesn't look like much from the outside but our room had a large comfortable bed, well equipped bathroom with a microwave and fridge. You also get free shuttles to the airport and a self service breakfast which had excellent variety. The staff were happy to look after our bags for a while after checkout (at noon) and you can get a pretty interesting view of the SFO airport runway from across the water.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevators were a bit dated and small, just fit two people and luggage.

review.title: Easy and convenient

Of course being close to the airport there's some background noise from planes, but not too much, didn't bother me.

I docked one star off the facilities because since the hotel is close to the airport, you can often hear the planes approaching. The place itself was clean where the eye could see. But while getting out stuff ready to leave, I noticed trash under the beds. Makes me wonder what type of cleaning they do. The beds were a bit odd. I also think the a/c in our room was not working properly since it never actually cooled. Besides that, it's a good place to stay for one or two nights. There's also an In-and-Out Burger nearby.

Noise wise I'm not one to pay attention, I actually enjoy watching the planes take off. I hardly notice the plane noise. The staff has always been great. The check out time is noon! So you have plenty off time. Also their is a great sports store I love to check out in Burlingame which is also why I stay in at this location. I honestly think the price is right for what you get in the area and for free parking and hot breakfast. It's not upscale but is also not a downscale it's does more than enough I plan to stay here when I visit SF.

review.title: Decent price and great location
review.reviewText: Good restaurants next door and overlooks the SFO landing strip and bay. There's a nice walk behind the hotel where you can watch the planes land, listen to the water and see beautiful sunsets. It's an old hotel, doesn't have modern in-room climate controls, and could use some updating - but the beds are decent. The only hotel on Old Bayshore Hwy I've stayed in that doesn't have rock hard beds/ at which I can get decent sleep. Very friendly staff and reliable shuttle service too. HOWEVER - I'd recommend staying on the front of the hotel, not overlooking the water. The sound of planes readying for takeoff travels across the water and is SOOOO loud! I've stayed at many airport hotels. I seriously think the planes sounded louder in my hotel room than while I was flying. But the front of the hotel doesn't have this problem (I stay here whenever I fly up for work).

She handed me my key card, and then sat down to play  on the computer.  I had to ask her in which direction should I pull my car around and where my room was.
That was not the welcome or direction I was expecting, and had to ask.  She seemed very put out.  Other than that, for the 2 nights I stayed, I fortunately did not have to deal with any other employees and just went about my business.
I looked forward to the continental breakfast both mornings.

Then I got a call Saturday afternoon that I was supposed to have checked out. I told them the same thing again.  When I returned in the afternoon they have moved my belongings to next door without my permission. review.title: Worst hotel I have been in for years.
review.reviewText:
The first room I was checked in to had mold all over the window sill and curtains.  The carpet was filthy and the room smelled of mold and other odors.  I asked to change rooms and was given another room.  The next room did not have the mold but the carpets were dirty, all sorts of holes in the walls, base boards were filthy dust and grime on many areas.  The worst thing was the noise of the airplanes taking off.  The windows were loose in the frames and the whole room shook when the airplanes powered up to take off.  I have traveled in many hotels near airports and never experienced such noise.  This hotel should not be recommended to anyone until it is renovated. I possibly got 2 hours sleep.  When we were preparing to check out there was so much smoke from burning what ever they were cooking that the doors had to be opened.  

I SINCERELY THINK I SHOULD RECEIVE A VOUCHER FOR FUTURE TRAVEL.

review.title: Nice hotel with beautiful views of the bay.
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel. When I arrived the employee at front desk was very helpful and generous. Enjoyed the fact the hotel is exterior corridor because I'm always in and out. I had a balcony and it was amazing, got to enjoy the bayview and watch airplanes which were not an issue at all. The rooms are small but I didn't mind because it was perfect for just me and my bf. Also loved that it's 18 & over and not far from San Francisco. I will definitely stay here again when I'm in the area.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: We booked a Bay view room & when we checked in the rather uninterested night receptionist offered us a room on the top floor or the ground floor. We took the top floor. When we got to the room, the carpet was wet, also the veneer was broken aroung the sink basin. The carpet had been cleaned,my partner slipped as she went into the bathroom, not realising that the carpet in the bedroom was wet. We asked for a room change & were given the ground floor room, That overlooked the Bay but the view was hidden behind the sea wall. That room also had a bathroom ceiling panel that was sagging, possibly due to dampness. Another main problem is the air conditioning -- WHATEVER you set the controller in the room to you get what reception has set. The room was warm when we arrived, so we set the air con to cool whilst we went out for a meal. When we arrived back the room was like an oven, the air con was pumping out hot air. When I went to reception the rather unconcerned agent said that because it was cool outside reception had set the air con to warm, so we had NO direct control over the room temperature. You do not need this when arriving at 10pm at night. The breakfast was quite good but with only 2 tables on the inside of the building - the others (about 4) were on the outside. Whilst waiting in the reception 2 other guests went to reception with complaints. In general the hotel looked tired and in desperate need of a face lift. The only 'Executive' thing about this hotel the sign.
review.negativeRemarks: The decor, the air con, make the room facilites work (2 drawers would not open (room 121)). Lack of electrical sockets in the room.

Other reviews mentioned here listed proximity to the street / highway / airport as a negative due to noise.  I did not find this to be a problem during my stay. Thumbs up from this business traveler.

Nothing fancy, fairly old, however, it was just for a night and then another night when we were on our way home. 

Very friendly staff except one, she was not helpful, the first encounter I had with her she was busy eating and really had no idea about the area we were in after I asked her a question. After our trip we came back to stay before an early morning flight, she was sleeping at the front desk, I stood there for a bit and then had to wake her because she was not waking up. We dealt with, I believe 4 other staff and all were excellent, I would not want this one to ruin it for the rest.

review.title: Nice Room... BUT
review.reviewText: The room was fine.  The breakfast was fine.  Not expecting anything more from a hotel airport.  However, I had 2 big gripes:  1.)  It was late June, and the A/C had not been turned on yet.  The desk clerk didn't even know if the heat was still on or if the A/C wasn't working.  She said it had been hot in the lobby, so she propped open the front door, and suggested I leave the sliding glass door open overnight to keep cool.  Yes, but our room faces a public walking/bike path about 10 feet from our room.  Are you kidding?   2.)  I wanted to print my boarding passes for my flight.  The computers in the lobby, which seem to date from around 1997, were surprisingly quick considering, but the printer had barely any ink, and didn't print the passes properly.  When I inquired about replacing the ink, the desk clerk replied they didn't have any more ink cartridges, and if they did, she didn't know where they were.  Again, you're kidding, RIGHT?!  She finally told me I could come around the desk and use the desk clerk's computer and printer.  Which was very nice of her, but really, it should not have had to come to that.

review.title: Great view. Comfortable bed. Decent sized room.
review.reviewText:
The staff was very pleasant at the Vagabond Inn. At the registration office there is free coffee, a variety of teas, and cookies available through out the entire day. Breakfast is available from 7am-9am. The menu contains scrambled eggs (a bit oily), bacon (yes), oatmeal (with cranberries and nuts for toppings), breads and bagels with various spreads.

The rooms are clean, we upgraded to the water-view rooms which added an addition $25/night. It was definitely worth it. The balcony faces the waterfront and you can watch planes take off all day and night. There are two chairs and a table there for dinner, cards, or just lounging. The sound of the planes is not bothersome so long as the windows are closed. Even if you leave the windows open its not a big nuisance, as I was able to sleep through the night.

Overall the experience was good. The only downside is that the rooms are fairly small. The closet is a hole in the wall as part of the bathroom. The layout the rooms maximize the bedroom space. That being said, I would absolutely stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Size of rooms
review.locationRemarks: There are multiple restaurants around including Benihana, and Kincaids. If you enjoy a jog, there is a path that can go for 9 miles around the hotel.

review.title: Quaint little Hotel with a beautiful view!
review.reviewText:
I stayed at the Vagabond for 4 nights while at a work conference. The overall experience was great. Small hotel rely great staff and its right on the water. The only noise I had was the upstairs neighbors. Make sure you as for a top floor. It's old with not much floor insulation. It sounded like they had 20 children with them.
Never, until now, have I stayed in a hotel where I liked the pillows. They were amazing!!! I have a difficult time with over-stuffed ones. These were magnificent!
There is an incredible array of restaurants within walking distance. If you want to go to Benihana I would recommend reservations. For convenience there is the Elephant Bar right next door. Great apps and a decent wine list. Enjoy! I have included a picture of the view from the backside of the hotel If you want to avoid the jets, make sure you get a front facing room :)

review.title: wish I spent the extra $50 and stayed elsewhere
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel for one night because I had a really long layover in San Francisco. The reviews were decent, but that wasn't my experience. For close to $100 a night, I really should have gone with one of the more established hotel chains in the area. Be aware that this inn is set up more like a motel. My room was facing the road, and I could hear everything, including people walking around outside, the elevator, even the guests next door going about their business. The room and furnishings were really old and everything smelled musty, but it was as clean as you could make it I guess. The breakfast was nice. The shuttle and front desk staff were pleasant. The shuttle was on time both times I used it. I wasn't impressed and would not book a room at this inn if I needed to stay in San Francisco any longer than one night.

review.title: They towed my photographers car!
review.reviewText: I chose this spot because the picture on the site looked amazing and wanted a room for a photo shoot. The room is basic, nothing special. The view from the balcony however is SPECTACULAR! The front desk staff were unfortunately not as communicative about the strict parking. My photographers car was towed for not having a parking permit after only being in the lot for 1.5 hours. We weren't aware of the strict enforcement of the parking and when we asked the staff about it they were rude and refused to assist us in any way. They insisted there were signs about the parking and there is only a small blue sign with writing so small it's barely visible and VERY EASY to miss. It's unfortunate because I may have come back as the view from the balcony is the only thing that makes this hotel special.

review.title: Very close to Airport Marriott, Free Shuttle
review.reviewText:
Its a good stay, not exceptional, but was OK for my purpose. I had a conference at Marriott, and this was just 1 minute walking away from that. Close to airport and free shuttle service was excellent. Also the free breakfast, It was awesome. Scramble eggs, muffins, coffee and fruits and more stuff I even don't remember. Bit crowded during breakfast, but not bad. It starts around 6am, so go early to beat the crowd.
I had a bay view executive room, but nothing special. Its not that much of a thing to look during this time of the year. It feels muddy and nothing special other than flights landing at SFO. After few hours its the same. So don't spend money for bay view room. You can walk and have the same view.

The place looks bit run down, more like a cheap motel. May the the place needs some paint job. Still I don't think you can take the cheap motel look away from this. There's nothing other than the front office, breakfast room and other rooms. More like a bed and breakfast place and not worth the $$$ I paid per day. Lucky my advisor paid for the stay. I guess compared to other places, this is cheap. But does not worth the rate I paid.

So, the best I can give is 3 OK stars.

review.title: Very pleasant airport hotel
review.reviewText:
Just don't get why this has a 2 rating. I had an upper bay view room which had fabulous views of water, palm tree paths, glorious sunrise and sunsets and all manner of bird life (and landing aircraft too....). Room was big, comfortable. Wifi worked.
OK, so it doesn't have a restaurant but there is a huge, very popular bar/restaurant right next door. And the breakfast space is frankly a bit farcical. And the free transit to the airport goes walkabout to other hotels first....
But for the price, the ability to be able to take a nice stroll along the seafront paths and stay somewhere with lovely views at a reasonable price must outweigh these little irritations??

review.title: Nice hotel with convenient location

The free hot breakfast was nice, but too little sitting space and quite crowded. The front desk is manned by only 1 person who has to answer phone calls, inquiries etc, so it can be a bit of a wait to get service there. The room is old but quite clean with good beds/pillows etc, and that's what we need (how often do you stay in the hotel when you are a tourist?). Very convenient for gas stations/access to freeway etc. There are 3 of us sharing the room (which was indicated on the reservation), but only 2 sets of towels: we do have to go and pick up an extra set, and also ask for a hair-dryer which was provided quite quickly. For the price charged, we think it is a good value for the money.

review.title: Budget hotel overlooking Bay
review.reviewText: The hotel might well have deserved the title "Executive" in the name a few years ago but more modern hotels close by are probably more deserving today of this description. Looking tired it is a budget hotel with basic facilities. Having said this it was comfortable, quiet and clean. It offered a limited hot buffet breakfast. It is situated close to the main SF airport overlooking the Bay. It offered an airport shuttle facility which in turn allowed connection to trains into the city centre. Close to the freeway there was no difficulty heading out of the city.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to airport and overlooking SF Bay.
review.locationRemarks: There is a walkway alongside the Bay and restaurants close by otherwise the sights of SF are in the city some 10 miles to the north.

review.title: Mediocre hotel
review.reviewText:
Hotel was expensive for what you got
Rug was not clean
Shuttle was very late picking me up
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport

managementResponses.response:
We appreciate you taking the time for your review. Glad you enjoyed both of your visits into the area. We hope to see you again soon.

Eli Jimenez
General Manager

review.title: Return visit!
review.reviewText: Friendly, nice complimentary breakfast, great shuttle service. This time I needed a wheelchair access room, and the room also had a roll-in shower. We have stayed here several times before, and our return visit was also a pleasure.
review.positiveRemarks: Airport shuttle every half hour, nice complimentary breakfast, free wireless internet, friendly service. Rooms clean and adequate. Modest price.
review.negativeRemarks: This is not a new hotel, but everything was in working order. I often find that I want more light in hotel rooms...and this was true here.
review.locationRemarks: There is a public walkway outside the hotel along the bay...to the right you can go to a couple of restaurants. To the left there is a small park.

managementResponses.response:
We appreciate you taking the time for your review. We are glad you enjoyed your stay with us, along with our friendly staff, clean rooms, and free hot breakfast. We hope you will consider us again, if you are in the area.

Eli Jimenez
General Manager

review.title: Budget Pleaser
review.reviewText: I can't complain too much about my stay at this hotel. Good value for the money. Free parking and free WiFi with a good signal. The free breakfast was also better than average, with good variety and also a limited fresh fruit salad. The only problem with the breakfast was the extremely small seating area just 2 tables. You can go outside but in San Francisco even in late August the temperatures are in the upper fiftes in the morning. The room was clean and no smell. Staff was friendly and helpful. 2 very good resturants next door. Small downtown 3/4mile away at Broadway, that I wished I had discovered earlier. Its still a bit far from downtown San Fran about 20 minutes where the parking is not as bad as rumored.
review.negativeRemarks: Enclose the breakfast area outside. Realistically there is no sitting area inside
review.locationRemarks: 2 good resturants nextdoor serving American and Mexican food

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for your review. We are glad you enjoyed your stay with us and our bay front view rooms.

Eli Jimenez
General Manager

review.title: Good value on The Bay
review.reviewText:
I had a Bay view room and that is what I would recommend. View of the Bay is across from end of the NW/SE SFO runway extension so if you like to watch planes land and take off, like I do, it is an added plus. Plane noise level is not bad even with the sliding door open. Close it and you barely hear anything. Very good restaurant/bar immediately next door.

Burlingame/San Mateo is great area for temperate climate. Warmer than The City and cooler than across the Bay. The hotel is dated a bit but maintained well. I travel with an extension cord in my bag and this is one of those occasions where it came in handy. Older hotels have more limited electrical outlets by design than new buildings. If you're like me and have multiple electronic devices...be prepared.
review.positiveRemarks: View. Bay breeze. Micro climate. Restaurant/Bar next door. Breakfast and coffee both pretty good. Convenience to airport. Walking path on water.

review.title: Overpriced, even for a slightly cheaper hotel
review.reviewText: I booked months in advance, 2 rooms; paid a higher rate for one with 2 beds and balcony overlooking the bay, the other was a king bed. Even at check-in I was told "one of rooms has a balcony". Found that the one with 2 beds had a window, no balcony. On checking with the front desk, they said that by "balcony" they meant the corridor in front. Nice. It's a motel style inn with open corridors ... it's not a bad hotel, but overpriced, IMO.
review.locationRemarks: Good thing ... 2 nice diners just next door - Elephant Bar, and El Torito

managementResponses.response:
Dear Traveler,
We will be working on a few phases of upgrading in the future and appreciate your constructive feedback.
Thank you

Eli Jimenez
General Manager

review.title: Not good value
review.reviewText: We didn't get what we paid for. The hotel desperately needs an upgrade, for example carpets worn and soiled. If you have a choice, look and book elsewhere.

review.title: Nice outlook over the bay and close to good food .
review.reviewText: Staff were very helpful, location close to airport. Breakfast was good and close to good restaurants with a lovely view over the bay.

review.title: Convenient location and comfortable stay
review.reviewText: Convenient location to and from San Francisco airport and for car hire locations. Value for money. Pass the breakfast menu though.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast menu
review.locationRemarks: Excellent if you want to be near the airport. The free airport shuttle is also a definite advantage.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: good experience breakfast was good, but area was too small
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast area was too small
review.locationRemarks: close to airport

review.title: Good value close to airport
review.reviewText: We stayed for one night before flying home. I is basically a motel but room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was fine. Nothing amazing but juice, coffee and some hot food along with usual muffins you get in hotels in US. Free shuttle to airport all worked well. We chose this hotel on proximity to airport and cost and felt we got value for money.
review.negativeRemarks: Bigger breakfast area

review.title: Breakfast is the only good thing
review.reviewText: I was so disappointed. I thought I was booking a bay side room but the description was misleading so I actually got one of the noisiest rooms near the staircase. The temperature of the room was awful and the knob on the thermostat was broken. I tried for hours one night to get internet access and every time I called the front desk they just kept telling me they could get online so they didn't know what the problem was in my room. The bed was good, and the breakfast was good, but not good enough to get me to stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: The full hot breakfast and the 24hour tea/coffee service was good.
review.negativeRemarks: Take the tissue out of peephole in the door. Also it would be nice if the thermostat had a knob on it.
review.locationRemarks: I was in the area for a state board exam so I only ate at the local restaurants. .

review.title: Convenient location and clean, comfortable room.
review.reviewText: I was there for 5 nights, taking care of business in the area. The staff was helpful, breakfast good, and location very convenient. I liked that it was on the water so it was fresh and calming. Get a room that is NOT facing the west parking lot and street. I made an online reservation for a "premium" room but was told that "premium" meant ocean view and that was $20 more per night. Then was told "oh, unless it says premium room with view" the room does not face the ocean, only the parking lots on other three sides. Convenient restaurants Elephant Bar and El Torito right next door, walking distance.

review.title: Comfortable room
review.reviewText: We stayed two nights at this motel and found the rooms to be comfortable and clean. Kids loved being able to search for crabs right outside of the motel in the near by bay. Would stay there again if ever in that neck of the woods again.

review.title: Adequate for a night's stay...no frills.
review.reviewText: Room was merely adequate and honestly overpriced for what it offerer. Old, dated and room had a hint of stale smoke.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: airport convenient

review.title: Good stay close to the airport
review.reviewText: The entire experience went well. This is not one of the taller high end hotels in the area but it also does not tack on fees etc. to be able to park. Just about or a little over $120 makes sense for what I received.

review.title: Disappointed - won't return.
review.reviewText:
I am disappointed and won't return. I was greatly disturbed that as I lay in bed at 9:30 a.m., the maid attemped to open my door without knocking or announcing herself. Fortunately I double locked my door. I spoke out that I wa still in the room and just heard her muttering. After throwing on some clothes, I went out and asked why she tried opening my door. She again muttered, "Oh I sorry, I sorry." I told her she should announce herself and knock first and that I was going to inform management - again she just said, "I sorry." I'm wondering if maids do this on a regular basis, so they can scout out your goods and pocket anything they find handy!

I also didn't like that they claimed to run out of register paper and couldn't give me a receipt when I arrived and when I left. While checking out, I had to give them my email address so they could send a receipt showing zero incidentals/balance. Upon returning home, I had a $50 incidental charge on my credit card! They apparently charge even before you have any incidentals. I didn't like talking to the desk person who had limited answers re: this charge. He later found out that it will automatically disappear from my account in 1-3 days.
I don't recommend it unless you get an excellent discount and don't pay more than $100. Very disappointed all around.
review.positiveRemarks: Free coffee, tea, and hot chocolate 24 hr.
review.negativeRemarks: The maid service needs to be overhauled -new training definitely and respect for privacy. It would help if the maids spoke English.
review.locationRemarks: The location is next to the water so it's stinky. The El Torito restaurant nearby is dirty - the bathroom was unsanitary-should have eaten elsewhere.

review.title: Affordable hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: I've used this hotel multiple times, and would recommend it to anyone traveling to SF. The shuttle service is very convenient taking you to the airport, and BART stations. It is close to an excellent restaurant, and also has a lot of room for free parking. The room itself is always clean with a fridge and microwave. The Wi-fi sometimes cuts out, but that is more of an ISP issue.

review.title: Utilitarian
review.reviewText: Okay place to spend the night if you are flying out early. Probably wouldn't linger here. The hotel rm was okay actually in terms of cleanliness other than the older carpet. Replacing that would be a big improvement. The breakfast area was too cramped and crowded. Poor layout meant constantly tripping over and into others. Very awkward. The hotel is located in a small neighborhood with about 4 restaurants that all had huge line ups/waiting lists. Would not recommend for families.
review.positiveRemarks: Very close to airport. Easy to find.
review.negativeRemarks: Old carpet, crowded breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Small town with only about 4 places to eat supper.

review.title: Good rate, good location!
review.reviewText: I stayed there the last week of June 2013. Very close from the airport, complimentary shuttle too starting at 4:00 am. Hot breakfast, just the basics, but good since you dont have may options close by. There is a boardwalk with amazing views right there.
review.positiveRemarks: Shuttle,view from the boardwalk and the breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Sometimes Internet can be a bit slow.
review.locationRemarks: 10 min from the airport, a couple of good restaurants for dinner next door and the Burlingame Sanctuary with great views.

review.title: Great room & breakfast!
review.reviewText: So reasonably priced I was expecting a fleabag. Quite the contrary, the bed/pillows/comforter were the most comfortable I've ever had away from home. The free breakfast had wonderful hot scrambled eggs and sausage, with American fries that were not greasy but very tasty, plus just about anything else you could want. My only complaint: the motion-sensor light switch for the room was located behind a curtain, so turned off periodically because it can't detect motion in the room there. A small price to pay for a very clean quiet room with a small refrigerator and microwave, coffeemaker, iron and board, alarm clock, cable tv, and free wi-fi plus all the above. I only stayed overnight on my way to the airport, but I've already recommended it to friends for park and fly. Oh, I forgot to mention the convenience to the airport and the on time shuttle that leaves every 1/2 hr.
review.negativeRemarks: Use regular light switch for overhead room light instead of motion-sensor switch (see above) and provide a paper guide to the cable channels received.
review.locationRemarks: Location is very convenient to the airport, but very quiet nonetheless. I didn't get to do things in the vicinity as I was just passing through.

review.title: Very convenient for the airport.
review.reviewText: Comfort, cleanliness and style of room were of pleasing quality. Obviously the close proximity to the airport meant that it is noisy and difficult to sleep into the early hours. Very convenient for the airport due to this proximity. Great views of the bay from rear of hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: airport noise during night
review.locationRemarks: Super convenient for airport and next door to elephant bar for gorgeous food.

review.title: Beautiful hotel near the bay
review.reviewText: Stayed one night room very clean staff extremely pleasant and professional excellent continental breakfast beautiful view of the bay close to many restaurants free shuttle to airport reasonable rates!!
review.positiveRemarks: nice room comfortable beds clean room and bathroom and a beautiful bay walk area right behind the hotel
review.negativeRemarks: room temperature was a little too warm
review.locationRemarks: bay and airport view---beautiful airport noise --not disturbing at all great restaurants nearby

review.title: Clean room and close to Airport
review.reviewText: Very noisey lots of people comming in real late. Got woke up at 12:30am and again at 2:30 am and then yet another time at 3:30 am. Just gave up and took the shuttle at 4:00am to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Control the loud noise. Put the drunks in one location.
review.locationRemarks: No time for anything but sleep and did not get any of that.

review.title: Flying in the San Francisco airport
review.reviewText: It was easy to find if you have a GPS. Bed and pillows were great. Had a handicapped room for some reason, did not need so bathroom (shower and sink) was not convenient for non-handicap person. Breakfast was good but short of tables and chairs, very busy.
review.locationRemarks: backs up the bay area

review.title: The Absolute Best!
review.reviewText: When we stayed at this hotel, we purchased the double bed room with an ocean view. The view was definitely amazing and the staff was very friendly. From our hotel room, we were able to see the runways of San Francisco International Airport. We were able to see planes land and take off right from our window. From our room we were able to see the San Mateo Bridge and the entire area is a beautiful sight at night. There is a walkway/path behind this hotel which is adjacent to the San Francisco Bay. You can run/walk along this trail and enjoy the crisp cool breeze from the SF Bay.The hotel is also very close proximity to other cities and downtown San Francisco. It only took us 20 minutes by car to get to Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel offers free breakfast every morning which consists of: egg, sausage, bacon, yogurt, muffins, bagels, oatmeal, fresh orange juice and coffee. We absolutley loved this hotel and that is why I want others to know about it also.

review.title: nice ccomfortable hotel
review.reviewText: it was easy to get there, friendly staff, comfortable rooms, maybe a bit stuffy.

review.title: A good one
review.reviewText:
If two queen beds, the room will be with big windows. We enjoy watching the airplanes taking off on the airport, a really nice review.
The staff are nice there. The breakfast is good, with furuits and coffee 24/7.
strongly recommend this one! Will definately be there again.

review.title: Ok for just a night before early flight.
review.reviewText: This hotel is kind of outdated. The check in went well and clerk was very nice. We went to our rooms and they were pretty clean, just sort of old looking. Our air conditioning didnt seem to be working and the room was too warm. Elevator was in a dark corner. During the night we did not feel safe. There was partying going in next door at Mexican restaurant and it went on for hours. Car alarms were going off all night as well. We got up at 3:00 to leave hotel by 4 for a 6:00 flight. Would have been nice to get a few hours sleep. Parking lot was well lit thankfully when we went out to the car.
review.negativeRemarks: Our air conditioning was not working well.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to airport do nothing close by but hotels. City of San Francisco was a 15 min drive.

review.title: Handy airport location/hot breakfast
review.reviewText: Needed a one night stay and the price was reasonable. Free wi.fi and parking, free hot breakfast in the am. The hotel rooms have been updated with new carpet and bedding, comfortable bed. It's right on a walking path along the bay. We paid a little more for a bay view, however, we were on the first floor which looked at a wall unless standing up. Also, no outside seating. The upper two floors had patio chairs and a table. Only real complaint...the hotel is on a hotel wide heating and cooling. So, our room was extremely hot at night. We didn't feel comfortable opening the patio since it was on the ground floor next to the walking path. Would stay here again, but only on an upper floor overlooking the bay. Also, change the plastic table cloths in the dining area, they are well past their usable life.
review.negativeRemarks: The lack of control of heating/cooling.
review.locationRemarks: South side of SFO, restaurant next door, hot breakfast, complimentary wi-fi and parking. The room was comfortable and the bed was nice.

review.title: hot day
review.reviewText: The only negative thing I have to say about this hotel is that the day I stayed it was hot. And the air conditioning wasn't working. Which made me wish I had booked a different hotel. Other than that the shower was nice and the bed was comfortable.

review.title: A home away from home.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Vagabond immensely. It was nice having our own coffee in the room. The hot breakfast each morning was a special treat. There were so many good choices and the food was hot. The hotel was about 4 miles from downtown which we also liked. We would recommend this hotel to our friends.
review.positiveRemarks: The hot breakfast and coffee in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Not enough indoor seating for breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Burlingame, Ca.

review.title: great hotel close to SFO
review.reviewText: Clean, recent renovations a great improvement . The Bayshore walk behind the hotel a great bonus before and after long days of traveling. Nice breakfast for families to save money. Convenient to restaurants and airport.
review.positiveRemarks: location and walk on the bay
review.negativeRemarks: little noisey
review.locationRemarks: great easy access to rental care return and airport

review.title: Good value for short stay.
review.reviewText: 1 King bed, 2 bed/nite tables, 1 desk,1 chair, and console to hold TV with a few drawers a refrig and microwave. OK for 1 person for 1 or 2 nights. Included breakfest was quite good. I would stay there again if it is just me for a few nights, it met my needs. Gas station close to get microwave popcorn and soda, microwave worked fine, life is good. Front desk made a couple of copies for me and later Faxed them @ n/c. A couple of places to eat close at hand. Price was right. I flew into SFO Saturday morning, had a 3 hour meeting did some work in the room Sat. nite and Sun. morning had 1 hour meeting and then caught a afternoon flight to ORD. I would stay here again for this type of trip.
review.positiveRemarks: Area I wanted to be in.
review.negativeRemarks: No real place to sit.
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport, and expressway for getting to meeting.

review.title: Great stop over close to airport.
review.reviewText: We arrived after 26 hrs of flying. Ana at the front desk was fantastic. She helped with evening meal plans, gave us information about getting around and got us to our rooms very efficiently. The room was comfortable and clean and a good bed was exactly what we needed after two days of traveling. We needed an adapter to charge some equipment and Ana went the extra mile to find what we needed.

review.title: A true value
review.reviewText: Great price and close to SFO. The room had a microwave and refrigerator, and with free breakfast, it is truly a value. Also had a iron and ironing board and hair dryer and a coffee maker. Outstanding!
review.positiveRemarks: Free breakfast, refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, SFO shuttle, reasonable, comfy bed..
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast area kind of small.
review.locationRemarks: Close to BART & CalTrain, restaurants nearby,

review.title: Recommended for stay before or after a flight.
review.reviewText:
Really comfortable room and bed. Quiet.Got a good nights sleep before flight out.
Nice restaurant "Elephant Inn" next door.
review.negativeRemarks: No one to carry bags. I was on ground floor so no problem but didn't see any elevators.
review.locationRemarks: Only 15minutes by shuttle from airport. Quiet.

review.title: Good place to stay if a/port important.
review.reviewText: good value for cost rooms clean but not large bed comfy breakfast a bonus close to a/port with shuttle available. Overall a pleasant stay.
review.negativeRemarks: bit noisy
review.locationRemarks: ideal for a/port with shuttle

review.title: It was okay for the $...We will not return!
review.reviewText: The rooms overall were okay for the money spent. It was a nice view from the balconies and even though the airport is right there the sound is not bad in the rooms. We all were able to sleep uninterrupted. The best part of this stay was their mattresses they were so comfortable. I only have one minor complaint. I had made this reservation almost a month in advance for two rooms. I assumed with that much notice that they would have at least been able to place the rooms somewhat close to each other. However upon checking in they literally gave the room next to us to the guests who were checking in right before us. Then they told me that the second room would be on the second floor on the other end of the hall. I felt that the room they had just given the people in front of us who had just requested the third floor, should have if it was not reserved for my second room. I felt that it was slightly wrong.
review.positiveRemarks: The mattresses were comfortable. The view was nice in the evening.
review.negativeRemarks: I did not like that they separated the two rooms so far apart considering how early on my reservation was made. The second room had minor problems.
review.locationRemarks: The location is convenient when visiting San Francisco for the weekend and you want to avoid SF pricing on the hotels.

review.title: Very clean and comfortable.
review.reviewText: Very clean and comfortable, and close to John Muir National Historic Site.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable and reasonably priced. Very friendly staff.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Good beds is about all that is good. Our room had ceiling tiles in the bathroom hangong out. Location is good for the airport and the "Elephant"resturant next door is great ,food, price and service.
review.negativeRemarks: Older and need repair
review.locationRemarks: South San Fran, Airport resturants are all close by.

review.title: Convenient place
review.reviewText:
Very good location.few min to SFO.restaurant is few staps away. and SF bay just behind of hotel.
Breakfast is OK, but area for eating is to small.
I hardly find electrical outlet for my PC.

review.title: A dreadful experience
review.reviewText: The bed was comfortable. That's the only positive. The room was musty and airless, the wallpaper peeling, the carpet stained, the bathroom in need of repair and refurbishing, the showerhead weak. We should have paid more for a better place.
review.negativeRemarks: Musty, airless, decrepit

review.title: Good for an airport overnight
review.reviewText: A reasonable and comfortable bed near the airport. Shuttle transport was easy and quick. Not fancy, but quite sufficient to our needs.

review.title: Good value for just a place to sleep at night.
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, and the beds were very comfortable. Good value for money. We were a family of 4, two young children. The two queens were good enough for us. Don't expect 5-star hotel service and facilities, but it is sufficient for a good night sleep. Only complaint is that the toilet vent is quite noisy, so we couldn't leave the toilet light on at night, and all other ceiling lights in room is motion-sensored, so if there is no motion detected after a period of time, the lights turn off automatically. We ended up getting a $1.99 nightlight that plugged into the toilet wall socket. Breakfast was a good mix of cold cereal and hot food, including waffle makers, and bacon, scrambled eggs on heated trays. Seating is very limited indoors, but on nice days, sitting outside is fine.

review.title: Excellent value.
review.reviewText: Included breakfast is very tasty. Rooms clean and beds comfortable. No gym or pool, things that will be missed by most families. Would be nice if desk staff could/would recommend a nearby gym or pool. Overall, the motels is an excellent value.
review.negativeRemarks: Really missed having a gym or a pool.
review.locationRemarks: Good

review.title: Unfriendly
review.reviewText:
Good location if you want to catch a flight at early morning. But the lady that helped us check in that night wasn't happy at all. She kept a straight face and was reluctant to answer my question. Mood swing maybe?
The room looked nice until I touched some gooey stuff under the clock while I was trying to set the alarm. It turned out we didin't need to set the alarm, at 6 AM next morning, we were all waken up by people upstairs, we could hear every footsteps and the screeky sound the floor made.
No wireless connection even though I was given a password for it. We could not get to the page to put it in.
Anyway, we won't return.

review.title: Great hotel and quite
review.reviewText: This hotel was great and for the price also great breakfast and staff next time I go back to frisco ill be staying In this vagabond
review.positiveRemarks: The great beds and smell of room
review.negativeRemarks: Really everything was great
review.locationRemarks: By the airport and slept like a baby

review.title: Close to SFO
review.reviewText: Close to airport. Free internet. Shuttle only once every 30mins, so may have to wait. Good for quick overnight stay.

review.title: Good value for the money
review.reviewText: Good value for the amount paid. Very convenient for a one night stopover. One staff member was unenthusiastic and uncommunicative which gave a bad starting impression, other staff were helpful and pleasant.

review.title: Reasonably good
review.reviewText:
At this price range, I can say this is relatively good hotel.
I am frequent visitor to SF bay area and stay several hotels around this area.
There are several other choices which are better but always cost more.
To me, as a biz traveler, internet access and cleanness is important and this hotel provides good ones.
review.negativeRemarks: frequency of shuttle to SFO
review.locationRemarks: Good access to SFO

review.title: convenient, clean, affordable
review.reviewText:
great accommodations. friendly staff, good breakfast for a reasonable price. also, parking is free in and out, hard to find in sfo.

definitely will go again
review.positiveRemarks: location and the walking path behind it
review.locationRemarks: walking distance to sfo and surroundings

review.title: Great Motel Near SFO
review.reviewText: We found the motel easy to access from the freeway and within easy reach of the S.F. Airport. There was ample parking. The room was clean, comfortable and quiet. The breakfast was actually very good with waffles, scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon and potatoes. Not the stuff you usually find at a motel breakfast. It was a great motel and the best airport area motel I have ever stayed in. We travel out of SFO several times a year and we will stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean, comfortable and quiet with easy freeway and airport access and ample parking. Good buffet breakfast.

review.title: Acceptable hotel in a convenient location
review.reviewText: The room I was in was noisy (air traffic, street and guest traffic), and was rather drab. No real problems, just not very nice. The hotel is very close to the airport, and very close to several decent restaurants.

review.title: Nice choice for a business trip.
review.reviewText: Great hotel for a business/pleasure trip. Comfortable and clean rooms. Friendly and helpful staff. My second visit and my next first choice in the Burlingame/San Francisco International Airport area.

review.title: Great place to stay..
review.reviewText: Very clean, recently renovated to include the bathrooms. Very close to the airport for those with early flights out of SFO. Good restaurants within walking distance of the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to the airport and a great bed.

review.title: Nice surprise
review.reviewText: Good location to airport and BART/CalTrain. Well lit outside. Good breakfast. Nice water views.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText:
I had a conference down the road at a much more expensive hotel. The Vagabond Inn was much less expensive, and only a 10 minute walk away, along the Public Shore. Very pleasant, no traffic, lots of shore birds to watch.

I did not take advantage of their breakfast or other amenities - just slept in the room, and used their Wi-Fi.

Very convenient to restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: The room didn't appear to have an operating thermostat. The heat was either on or off.

review.title: I'll be back..
review.reviewText: This is not the new hotel, but it has some good things going for it. I chose it because of medium price, it's near the airport and has a shuttle. My room was fine. Everything was in working order and good condition. There is a complimentary breakfast which offers a wide range of choices, everything from bacon and waffles to fruit. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. I would certainly choose to stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: hotel layout
review.locationRemarks: very near airport

review.title: Close to SFO; convenient for travelers
review.reviewText: I needed a hotel near SFO for overnite stay before an early morning flight. Would not pick this as a destination hotel. Room was clean but furniture has seen better times. It served my purpose. Suggestion would be to start breakfast at 5 to accommodate those of us who have very early flights. Their breakfast currently starts at 6 and. Needed to leave at 5:15 so missed out on included breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Good

review.title: Convenient to SFO Airport
review.reviewText: The room was very nice. However, the elevator was small and slow and was accessible only by walking around to the side of the building.

review.title: A comfortable place for a tired traveler to rest
review.reviewText: The hotel was very comfortable for a tired traveller. It was very clean, and it was charming to see little touches like towel fan arrangements. The shuttle staff was also very professional and made transit easy.

review.title: great
review.reviewText: great continental breakfast, staff was helpfull would stay again

review.title: Reasonably nice
review.reviewText:
Close to SFO, it's convenient to get access.
WiFi was reasonably high speed which gives me chance to some work in the room.

The only reservation is frequency of shuttle bus to SFO. As one of the key value of the hotel is it's access to SFO as I wrote in front, it's better to provide more frequent shuttle which now is every 30min.
review.negativeRemarks: Shuttle frequency
review.locationRemarks: Great access to SFO

review.title: You get what you pay for!!!
review.reviewText: You get what you pay for, so the price reflects what is offered by this hotel.

review.title: Beyond My Expectations!
review.reviewText: This hotel was a hidden Gem. We arrived and by the name we thought that it would be slummy but it was VERY CLEAN, Not too far from the City and within short drive to lots of restaurants. The Soaps, and amenities were all classy, and the breakfast was great! The hotel was updated the room was large and had new tile and clean carpet, and the internet worked great! Loved the Price!
review.positiveRemarks: Large, Clean, Updated,Good Community, Great internet, and very nice staff,great breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Close to Airport and restaurants, good neighborhood

review.title: Excellent choice for the business traveller
review.reviewText: I would certainly recommend the Vagabond Inn in Burlingame. The King bed was nice and firm. The room was quiet. There's a nice walking trail right behind the hotel. SFO airport is just a few minutes drive away.Several dining spots nearby. The staff was polite and helped when I needed a question answered.
review.negativeRemarks: No choice of heat or cooling. One or the other depending on the season.
review.locationRemarks: Easy access from Hwy 101. SFO only minutes away.

review.title: I have no complaints
review.reviewText:
Arrived in SanFran around 11:30 pm and the hotel shuttle picked us up fairly quickly.
Room was what i had reserved, king w/bay view. Breakfast each morning was very filling. Staff was helpful, i had many questions.
Enjoyed having the free wi-fi and the hotel shuttle to take us to the airport to jump on the Bart.
All in all a very enjoyable trip.
Would recommend this hotel. If you want something super fancy, probably not for you.
But its nice.
review.negativeRemarks: small breakfast room and no close drug stores or grocery stores
review.locationRemarks: Location on Bayshore was accessible to most things

review.title: Short Stay
review.reviewText:
It served its purpose.
xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to airport and shuttle service. Breakfast was pretty decent as well.
review.negativeRemarks: Not many restaureants in the surrounding area walking distance.

review.title: Impressive hotel at a very reasonable price.
review.reviewText: Very convenient for the airport with a reliable free shuttle every half hour. Facilities are impressive for a budget hotel, with free access to WiFi, free use of a printer to print boarding cards etc, free coffee/tea/soft drinks available all day, A good breakfast was provided but the breakfast room is small, although seats are available outside if the weather is fine. Air conditioning ducts were a bit noisey. A good view of the bay is available from most rooms, and good quality restaurants within a few minutes walk.
review.positiveRemarks: Good price, lots of useful services and most of them for no charge
review.negativeRemarks: noisy air conditioning. Reception staff could e a little more friendly
review.locationRemarks: Close to restaurants,nice view of the bay area, and good walks available along promendae which is immediately adjacent to the hotel

review.title: Great cheap base for exploring San fran
review.reviewText: Good cheap base to explore San Fran. Nice staff, comfy bed, barely noticed any airport noise, good selection for breakfast. Free transfers to airport to catch Bart train into city. Really impressed for a fairly cheap hotel.

review.title: Very good value.
review.reviewText:
Very pleasantly surprised at the hotel. It was clean and neat. Rooms were quiet.
Bathrooms clean. Everything worked. Beds were comfortable. Love the comforter.
Only thing was room temperature. Way to warm and not easy turn down.
Would I go back, yes.
review.negativeRemarks: Heat
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient

review.title: Convenient for the airport
review.reviewText: Very convenient for the airport and the inclusive breakfast enabled us to fill up before we caught our flight home at 11am. They also do a free airport shuttle which we didn't use as we had a hire car we needed to return but the info I saw showed that the shuttle was very regular. Nice location on the bay- we enjoyed sitting out in the evening and watching the planes queue up to land at SFO over the bay. Free wifi and parking and generally a nice comfy room. Did the job for our last night's stay.
review.positiveRemarks:
Proximity to the airport.
Free breakfast.
Free to use computer and printer which was handy for online flight check in and printing boarding passes.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing to report

review.title: Comfortable and convenient
review.reviewText: Great breakfast buffet with eggs and breakfast meats, cereals, baked goods, etc. Very convenient to the sirport. Quiet. We did not hear any noise from the airport or planes though. Water pressure was very weak in the shower. That was the only thing we didn't like about this hotel.

review.title: Accommodating airport hotel.
review.reviewText: Very comfortable room. Close to the airport with frequent shuttles. Staff was very accommodating for an early check -in. Excellent complimentary breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Five minutes from airport with frequent shuttles. Easy access from Hwy. 101.

review.title: Near by ocean, very good view
review.reviewText: Near by ocean, very good view, i will come next time

review.title: Good airport hotel
review.reviewText:
Proximity to the airport was our prime consideration and the courtesy bus to and from the airport was great. The staff, especially the gentleman who took us to the airport, were really helpful and the breakfast an added bonus.
Would recommend to travellers.
review.negativeRemarks: No lift to 2nd floor
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for the airport

review.title: San Fran Vacation
review.reviewText: Although it was only for 1 night, our hotel experience was very good. The hotel is a little dated but the room was very clean and had all the amenities. The morning breakfast was especially good and we enjoyed eating on the outdoor patio. The staff were very helpful and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: bathroom was a bit dated.
review.locationRemarks: location was ideal for the event we were attending in San Francisco

review.title: Great stay for budget travellers
review.reviewText: Stay was great. Room was clean. Booked a king premium view at first floor, and the View from the balcony was simply great and you could see planes land and take off. Nothing too fancy in this motel look alike hotel yet comfortable, clean and a pleasant stay.

review.title: Good place for the night
review.reviewText: My wife and I just needed a place for one night. We came in late and left early after breakfast. Breakfast which was good, eggs, sausage, toast, etc.. Hotel was easy to find. Seemed like a safe area. Room was clean. Quiet enough, although I wouldn't recommend a room near the stairs due to some people banging their suitcases up and down the stairs.

review.title: Ok for a night or two
review.reviewText:
This is a good place to stay for an overnight. Free parking, Internet, airport shuttle and morning continental breakfast. Rooms are basic and beds are too soft. Bathrooms are a little worn as are the carpets in the room.

Like I said, one maybe two nights and that is it. Anything loner, look at the bigger hotels for comfort.
review.negativeRemarks: Worn and tired looking rooms
review.locationRemarks: Location is near SFO and there is a walking trail behind the hotel.

review.title: Great place to stay for anyone!
review.reviewText:
This hotel was nothing fancy but a nice, clean, comfortable place to stay. I especially liked the way the tub and toilet were separate from the sink area so that my husband could be showering and I could be using the sink and vanity for getting ready for our day. I also liked the liquid soap dispensers used in both areas instead of bottled or barred soaps. Very nice addition and Eco-friendly!
I especially enjoyed the hot breakfast as well as cold breakfast items offered as part of the cost of the room. Excellent food was prepared, good coffee and lots of condiments too!
The only somewhat negative thing I would say is that the dining area was extremely small and not easy to navigate around others to get food on your plate. There was only enough room for 2 round tables in the middle and that also made it difficult to get around them. They did have seating outside but chilly, San Francisco mornings made it a cool breakfast sitting outside. I would suggest that they expand the dining area to include more inside dining tables and a roomier section to get and prepare plates of food. Otherwise, I would recommend this hotel. The beds were comfortable, room was extremely clean and equipped with everything you need and the hotel staff were friendly and accommodating!
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness, friendly staff, great breakfast and everything you need in a room.
review.negativeRemarks: small breakfast dining area
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco, California, near the SFO airport

review.title: Fine place for an overnight airport spot.
review.reviewText:
Comfortable for a night's stay. Close to lovely walkway around the bay-great location to watch planes, as we are former pilots, that's alot of fun for us!
Efficient staff, airport shuttle on time and actually a trip in itself! Enjoyed Houlihan's for our final night's dinner....worth the short drive !
review.negativeRemarks: the grounds were freshly watered, so a bit muddy for shoes and luggage to and from the room.
review.locationRemarks: we are airplane watchers, so it's perfect.

review.title: Convenient hotel for late arrivals from the airpor
review.reviewText: Location has the advantage to offer restaurants to have late dinners next to the hotel
review.positiveRemarks: Close to airport, breakfast include, and shuttle service
review.locationRemarks: There are restaurants to have late dinners next to the hotel

review.title: Clean and Convenient to SFO
review.reviewText: The Vagabond is more like a motel with outside room entrances. For the price the room was clean, comfortable and convenient to the airport. The breakfast was nice with many choices but limited seating (2 tables). We spent one night before an early morning flight and that was perfect. Airport shuttle has pick up every 1/2 hour and there were only 2 other stops after.

review.title: good price near airport
review.reviewText: Rooms are small, but okay for one person. Rooms are becoming a little dated. Breakfast was good, nice choice.

review.title: Don't bother with the Vagabond Inn Executive
review.reviewText:
Shower head was very low...only a very short person could get underneath it

Heating and airconditioning were not adjustable from room...it was extremely hot and we had no way of toning down the heat.

The breakfast area was very small with only two tables available...the waffle makers generated so much heat that we couldn't stay in the room...again unable to control the heat or cool.

Hotel had no luggage storage facilities.
review.positiveRemarks: Woman at check-in was very nice
review.negativeRemarks: Almost everything
review.locationRemarks: Location was fine

review.title: Close to the airport
review.reviewText: The staff was not very friendly. The room was a handicap room, so no bathtub. However, the breakfast was delicious, and the shuttle to the airport was very helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: the breakfast, the shuttle to the airport, the public walk by the Bay, close to several restaurants
review.negativeRemarks: small, handicap room; unfriendly employees
review.locationRemarks: very convenient by the airport and on the Bay

review.title: Excellent stopover to visit San Francisco
review.reviewText: Stayed before and our return trip lived up to expectations, with an excellent breakfast to set you on your way
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent location near the Bay, good breakfast, and wide TV channel choice
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Excellent with good Airport shuttle

review.title: Decent stop over motel.
review.reviewText: You could not control the temperature in your room. The night clerk she was VERY unfriendly wouldn't work with us at all! The towels were stock poorley. The breakfast was ok. The morning girl was very friendly and helpful!
review.negativeRemarks: The front morning staff. The lack of towels in room.
review.locationRemarks: Burlingame

review.title: Only if no other option.
review.reviewText: Air Conditioner did not work, very noisy (slamming doors, people yelling in the hallways). TV had VERY limited options. Bed was comfortable if we had been able to sleep over the noise.
review.negativeRemarks: noisy
review.locationRemarks: not as close to airport as advertised

review.title: Helpful staff
review.reviewText: The person at the front desk was very helpful. I had no clue about the public transit system and she was nice enough to not only tell me which stops I needed to get on and off at but she also drew on the map for me which areas would get me closest to where I needed to go. She went above and beyond very great service.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, shuttle every 30minutes on the dot two Bart/SFO
review.negativeRemarks: A little dirty and bad TV
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport about five minutes via the free shuttle

review.title: WOULD RETURN AGAIN
review.reviewText: THE ROOM WAS NOTHING FANCY BUT THE BED WAS COMFORTABE WITH A NICE COMFORTER AND PILLOWS. THE BREAKFAST WAS GOOD FOR BEING FREE, HOT AND COLD ITEMS TO PLEASE MOST. CLOSE TO THE AIRPORT AND THE 101. YOU COULD HEAR THE PLANES TAKING OFF BUT IT TURNED TO A WHITE NOISE AFTER A WHILE. JOGGING ALONG THE BAY WAS NICE BUT AS YOU GOT CLOSE TO THE AIRPORT YOU COULD BREATHE THE FUMES. OVERALL THERE WERE TWO RESTURANTS IN WALKING DISTANCE WITH BARS. HAD FRIENDS OVER AND THEY LIKED THE AREA.

review.title: very happy
review.reviewText: this hotel was a pleasant surprise.. we booked based on location and customer reviews. the only complaint would be the lack of bacon and didn't like the powdered eggs... it is a very small breakfast room, but they have tables outdoors so it makes up for it.. easy to get around and it is a nice retreat from busy San Fransisco.. i would recommend this hotel to all

review.title: Expedia and Vagabond
review.reviewText: Old, dirty and furnishings were outdated. Mattress sagged in the middle, next time I would pay more and stay else where.
review.negativeRemarks: Run down
review.locationRemarks: Nice water front to walk along

review.title: Reasonable rates with great free breakfast.
review.reviewText: We (my husband, myself and 2 teenage kids) stayed just 1 night and things were clean and comfortable. The free breakfast was great as well. My very picky daughter even liked breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: A little noisy
review.locationRemarks: Easy to find and close to the airport.

review.title: ok accomodations close to SFO
review.reviewText: More of a multi-level motel than hotel, this place is aimed at and convenient for people flying in and out of SFO who are more budget-aware. It was a hot day when we checked in, and the room hadn't been opened in at least a couple of days, so it was initially stuffy, but between opening the window and turning on the a/c, things improved. Not as much noise from aircraft as I might have expected.

review.title: "Ok place to stay for a night"
review.reviewText: Room was pretty average, nothing special. When we went to our room, it was pretty cool and wanted to turn up the heat to get the chill out, it didn't work when I tried to turn it on. I called the front desk to see what I needed to do and they sent a man to look at it, he couldn't get it to work either. He did offer to get a portable heater, which I accepted, he soon returned with it and it did do the job for us. This is a good place to stay if you're going to the airport to fly out. They do have a nice continental breakfast in the morning, was in a crowded area, but the food was great.
review.negativeRemarks: Continental breakfast eating area is way to small.
review.locationRemarks: Good location, close to water, walking path behind is nice.

review.title: Vagabond: a nice not-d/t spot by the bay
review.reviewText:
Slightly older building but well maintained. We paid an upgrade fee to get a room on the water and it was worth it but ask for a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor so that you get a balcony.

Staff were very helpful. Breakfast buffet was hot and plentiful and waffle maker was fool-proof to use. Traditional breakfast menu (eggs, bacon/sausage, homefries, yogurt, oatmeal, juice, etc.)

Shuttle to airport was convenient and it is just a short drive. Great access to BART and CalTrain stations. (Hint: you can take the airport shuttle back to the airport and then catch a BART train from there if you want to head into SF to sight-see.)

The hotel does not have a restaurant but there are two next door. There is no shopping to speak of in walking distance.

The location is great if you are planning on spending some time in downtown SF and some time in SJ or travelling around the area. It is easy to get downtown from the Vagabond but if your expectation is to spend the vast majority of your time in SF itself then you might want to a different location.

And while the hotel is located next to the SF airport it is not under any flight paths so you really do not notice the planes.
review.negativeRemarks: No restaurant
review.locationRemarks: 5 min. shuttle ride from SF airport with easy access to Highway 101, BART and CalTrain stations, 15 min. drive from d/t (outside of rushhour)

review.title: Good hotel even w/o the pool
review.reviewText: NIce hotel. We were only there for one night. No pool or hot tub which disappointed the kids, but no big deal for me. The only flaw was the small seating area for breakfast. If you want a good meal, go 2 miles down the road to L&L Hawaiian bbq. Low price and excellent food!

review.title: Great friendly hotel
review.reviewText:
We were met by Janet at the check in desk after a long day of traveling. Very friendly and helpful with directing us on where to get a bit to eat at the late hour. Held our bags so we could run next door to eat, gave great info on transportation available to the airport and fishermans warf . Great breakfast in the morning.

Steve, Brecksville Ohio
