review.title: Solid travel hotel.
review.reviewText: A simple travel hotel. Old, but clean with good staff. The free breakfast was better than most with eggs, sausage, waffles, yogurt, fresh cut fruit, and assorted breads and pastries. There is road notice in the morning, since te doors face out. Overall, it is a good stay.

review.title: OK for quick overnight stay.
review.reviewText: OK. Close to airport. Shuttle bus stops at several other hotels - thus taking much longer than it should and also filled up to standing-room only capacity! Hotel site did not mention that it was a "shared shuttle".

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location....great price. Desk service was good.
review.negativeRemarks: A bit dated
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Relaxing short stay
review.reviewText: Great place for a short stay. Good value . Front desk staff needs to be more professional and efficient
review.negativeRemarks: staff/front desk
review.locationRemarks: Super convenient, next to the San Francisco airport

review.title: Good choice for an overnight stay near SFO
review.reviewText: Comfortable spot for 1 night before catching a 6 a.m. flight out the next morning. Breakfast options looked great, although I wasn't able to sample due to having to catch the 4:30 a.m. shuttle to the airport (which was right on time#. Great location, right by a path that follows a protected shoreline reserve. Perfect for a pre-dinner walk or run. As a great alternative to the pricey #and rather colorless# chain restaurants on the main street, check out Mr. Terriyaki, a small family run Japanese restaurant just down the block #going toward the Hyatt#. Very good #and inexpensive) food that can be eaten either on the premise or packed up to go back to your room.
review.positiveRemarks: Good value for the price. Quiet. Nice sheets and plenty of TV channel options.
review.negativeRemarks: Towels were a little on the thin side.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the airport -- perfect spot to catch the free shuttle.

review.title: Vagabond Inn Executive San Francisco Airport
review.reviewText: This is a very basic hotel but is well situated close to SFO and reasonably priced. Close to a couple of restaurants and breakfast included. I have stayed here often when flying out early the next morning and haven't had a bad experience yet. Set your expectations realistically and you won't be disappointed.
review.negativeRemarks: Limited seating for breakfast
review.locationRemarks: One of the closest off airport hotels next to SFO

review.title: Not As Advertised...
review.reviewText: Not what I expected from the reviews, etc. Room was disappointing overall.
review.negativeRemarks: Overall condition of room.

photos.caption: view of the airport from our window

review.title: Nice place, close to the airport!
review.reviewText: In addition to the great location, this hotel had an incredible view of the bay at a great price. We would definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: view, price, proximity to the airport

review.title: Nice & clean... Friendly staff
review.reviewText: A nice, clean, hotel for a one-night stay near the airport. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was very good, although seating was very limited. Very fast and easy access from the airport. Free parking!
review.positiveRemarks: Free parking and a good breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Easy to find and close to SFO airport.

review.title: ok hotel
review.reviewText:
The outside looks like it needs work. When you drive up, bit disappointing.
The bedding between the sheets was groce. Was turning a dingy color, looked like it needed replacement.
We chose the hotel because we thought it was next to the water and it was a check in, then in the morning when we wanted to show our girls, it was a mud hole.
breakfast couldnt even get to as no room. Not enough space for all individuals.

review.title: "Business travel"
review.reviewText: This hotel is perfect if you are traveling for business. It is about 10 minutes from the airport. You have 3-4 good restaurants in walking distance. The rooms are clean. I will stay there again.

review.title: You have no control of your room environment
review.reviewText: Checked in around 6PM, the room faces west and the drapes were open to the sun, room quite hot when we entered. We closed the drapes and turned the airconditioner on high cool and left for dinner. Returned to room around 8:30 and found it was stifling. Front desk said that they didn't have airconditioning at this time, that it was a central air/heating system, that turning it to high cool was actually turning on the heat. They had no other rooms to give us. Our only option was to open the door, they brought up a 12" square table top fan for us. While the room did cool down after about 2 hours, I was extremely uncomfortable leaving the door wide open for that length of time, unable to undress or relax, exposing us to potential harm from anyone who wanted to enter, and I also cannot understand how my individual comfort is left to the hotel to decide for me whether or not I need AC. We paid on-line for non cancellable reservations so had to stay. Seemed like a nice enough hotel, but if I cannot control my own room environment, I will not stay there again.

review.title: Good stay
review.reviewText:
Nice clean motel, good location, houskeeper are great.

Pillows needs to be replaced.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast lounge a bit small and the pillows
review.locationRemarks: For us was excellent

review.title: Great breakfast
review.reviewText: Excellent breakfast and free internet was wonderful as we needed to re-book the second part of our trip. Making waffles for breakfast in the morning was an education!
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast and the sea view. Nearby cafe and restaurant also good.
review.negativeRemarks: Concrete and debris on the 'beach' outside
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient for the airport and not noisy.

review.title: Need Shuttle service?
review.reviewText:
Went there just for a night. Two things are important for me at airport hotels: Wi-Fi and the free Airport shuttle. Got in to SFO late at night. Waited 30 mins for the bus. It wouldn't take us because it was full. (bus is shared with 2 bigger hotels.) The driver told us to wait another half hour. Took taxi - $20. No compensation, no sorries. If you depend on the shuttle service, pick a different hotel.
By the way, there is a sign outside the hotel stating that in that building chemicals are being used that may cause cancer. (saw that after checkout.). Normal? Don't know.

review.title: Pleasant!
review.reviewText: Clean and close to restaurants. Nice path for walking and great view by the bay! Shuttle to take you to the airport!
review.negativeRemarks: I called to set up a wake up call but no answer. It was ok, I set my own alarm!

review.title: Great, but avoid rooms adjacent to the parking lo.
review.reviewText: I had a room fronting to the parking lot that was noisy all night with the comings and goings of other guests. That's my only complaint.

review.title: Very Comfortable, Free Shuttle and Free WI-FI.
review.reviewText: My wife and I enjoyed our stay at the Vagabond Inn Executive San Francisco Airport, especially because of the convenience of having a free airport shuttle. It was not only available to get from and to the airport on arrival and departure, but every half an hour for our entire stay. A great help to go to the airport to catch the BART into the CBD and return. Much easier than walking to the nearest CALTRAIN station. The room was comfortable and quiet, even though the airport was across the bay. Tea and coffee available in the foyer 24 hours, a great asset. If you were lucky you even received a cookie or two. The free WI-FI was most welcome and having a computer available in the foyer was also great. The free breakfast was great, with a good variety to select from. My only criticism was how small the breakfast area was. A roof and extension out the side would be a great plan to increase the space.
review.positiveRemarks: Having the free shuttle available whenever you needed it, the free WI-FI also the availability of a computer, great breakfast and friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The small space for breakfast, but could be extended out.
review.locationRemarks: Handy to the airport and having the free shuttle to the airport easy to get into the CBD by the BART train. Only a 20 minute journey.

review.title: We were satisfied
review.reviewText: The beds were very comfortable. LOVED the beds. Double rooms have no balcony, though, so don't pay extra for a double room on the bay side. Breakfast was okay, but breakfast room was very small and cramped. Staff was friendly and helpful. There was a great little cafe less than a block away. Easy access to San Francisco. Free shuttle to the airport where you can pick up the BART train.

review.title: Overall Good Choice of Lodging Near the Airport
review.reviewText: Nice location, view of the airport and walking paths by the bay. Breakfast is the typical continental fare, but enough to hit the spot in the morning. A stone's throw from the airport and one of the most reasonable places to stay in the area.
review.negativeRemarks: Doors slammed and walls kind of shook, breakfast area very small for crowds.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: Nice, clean, reasonably priced hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful and the complimentary breakfast was delicious although don't leave going until the end of the time slot else there is less choice. The beds are extremely comfortable and having a large fridge in the room is a bonus. Had a room with a view of the bay which was nice. The hotel is very close to the airport so if you are a light sleeper you may not sleep well due to the aircraft noise. The complimentary shuttle to and from the airport was very comfortable and the ride downtown on the BART takes around half an hour costing around $8.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice breakfast and excellent shuttle service.
review.negativeRemarks: The noise from the planes can be a little disturbing if you like to sleep with the windows open.
review.locationRemarks: Good location close to airport.

review.title: Cozy and clean
review.reviewText: I am from San Francisco and getting a decent hotel for a decent price is extremely difficult. Although it is outside of the city, everything else was satisfying and I would definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: The view and the housekeeping services
review.negativeRemarks: Distance from San Francisco is about a 20 minute drive without traffic

review.title: Fine for an overnighter
review.reviewText: For the price, less expensive than hotels around it, it was a great place to stay.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for getting to SFO for a flight

review.title: Okay for the price.
review.reviewText: There were nice and clean duvet covers however the room was tiny and had a musty smell.
review.positiveRemarks: Duvet covers and airport shuttle were a definite plus. Quiet even though close to airport.
review.negativeRemarks: musty smell and tiny room
review.locationRemarks: beautiful location, close to airport

review.title: Vagabond - best value!
review.reviewText: Excellent place to stay for the price. Breakfast is fantastic. Great place for that last night in SF. Only drawback was the noise from the highway.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location. Worked great with the shuttle to airport.

review.title: Overall just fine
review.reviewText:
POSITIVES: I stayed here for a conference that was held at a very expensive hotel down the road a few blocks. The Vagabond was less than half the price and was still a convenient place to stay. Parking was easy. The room was recently renovated and in excellent condition. The free breakfast was good, as far as hotel breakfasts go. Free wi-fi worked well.

NEGATIVES: It a motel, not a hotel, so you're dealing with rooms that face the outdoors. There's a bit of outdoor noise to contend with (traffic, airport noise, people talking) but nothing too terrible--mostly in the morning when it was time to get up anyway. The staff are competent but rude and aloof. They appear to be largely understaffed; the employees would probably be more polite if they weren't rushing from one customer to the next and taking calls at the same time. The room looked clean at first glance, but there were a pair of abandoned panty hose on the floor (ew!) and dust and dirt in odd corners of the room.

All this said, I would stay there again. It was a good price for the location, a decent room, and good easy free parking.

review.title: Inexpensive place for a night close to airport
review.reviewText:
OK place to stay over for morning flight from SFO.

We used it as a place that would allow us to drop the rental car off at night and use the free shuttle to airport in the AM.

Great breakfast buffet but dining area is so small we wound up taking the food to our room.
review.negativeRemarks: Long-in-the tooth older motel with outside access to rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Veyt close to airport with free shuttle every 30 minutes

review.title: Great value for $$$
review.reviewText: Free breakfast and hourly airport shuttle. Next to really cool restaurant. Hotel is a little older but was everything we needed. Would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Free hourly shuttle to aiport- connected us to BART subway.

review.title: first time visit to SF
review.reviewText:
very close to train station.. short walk for me..... LOL

then there's two restaurants next door to enjoy drinks, dinner and even karaoke
review.positiveRemarks: the fluffy down comforter on the King bed and the free shuttle to airport
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: very close to three car rental places in case you don't want to walk to train station

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: Good place to eat right next door. Very convenient to the airport.

review.title: Would Stay Again
review.reviewText: Room was clean & comfortable with a nice view of the Bay. Hotel was quiet even though it is just across the Bay from SF Intl Airport. I would stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: View and walkway along the Bay
review.negativeRemarks: Small breakfast room
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to SF Intl airport

review.title: Great experience in all respects.
review.reviewText: We stayed for 5 nights. Vagabond exceeded all our expectations. We'll be back.
review.negativeRemarks: Small eating area.
review.locationRemarks: Great.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Great for business travel, updated new mattress, newly added hot breakfast, HBO, and newly upholstered sofa arm chair. I have been staying here for over 20 years and saw the improvements little by little by the current owner.
review.negativeRemarks: airport noise if room facing airport,
review.locationRemarks: excellent

review.title: Comfortable and well situated to SFO
review.reviewText: Well located for the Airport and easy to find. Ergonomical room. Only place that had a ceramic bath of all the 8 hotels/inns we stayed on this trip. Comfortable bed. Good breakfast (hot and cold selection) but only two tables to sit at in the crowded breakfast area, plenty others outside. Best selection of teas, very extensive choice! Elephant Bar next to the Inn came recommended (the receptionist). Convenient, busy, fair selection and reasonably priced.
review.negativeRemarks: Congested breakfast area
review.locationRemarks: Proximity to SFO

review.title: Food and path made the hotel a good stay.
review.reviewText: After a very long travel day where everything that could go wrong, did go wrong, we checked into the Vagabond at about 6:30 pm. We were not met with smiles or any show of friendliness whatsoever from the gal who checked us in. I asked for a quiet room and she put us right by the front desk, room 103. I was wondering how it would be quiet with the foot traffic of people going to the front desk area for breakfast, people parking around there to check in/out and it was near the street. It ended up being ok. Maybe it is quieter than being on the airport side. I was pleased with the breakfast and the running trail. If you go one direction all the way to the end and then do the same going the other direction from the hotel, you can get in a 3 mile walk/run. The view is very nice and you will see a lot of interesting birds etc. If you are planning on heading to Napa or up the coast at all, stay on the other side of San Francisco. We had to go through the city for all of our destinations which definately adds on travel time. The hotel provides healthy and not so healthy breakfast options. I opted for the oatmeal and fruit each morning. They also had sausage, scrambled eggs, potatoes, yogurt, cereal, juices, muffins, toast, bagels and waffles. We ate at the nearby Mexican restaurant (2 parking lots over) and it was very good. Finally, the cookies that the Vagabond serves at night are quite good. Overall, I was pleased.
review.negativeRemarks: The check in lady needs to be friendly! Smile please! It is your JOB to make people feel welcome.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport. It was fun to watch the airplanes take off.

review.title: Road noise
review.reviewText:
This hotel does not seem to be in the best part of town.
There was a ticking nose coming from the air conditioning unit all night,then the road noise starts at around 6.0am
review.negativeRemarks: the ticking nose coming from the air conditioning unit
review.locationRemarks: not in the best part of town

review.title: Vagabond Inn San Francisco
review.reviewText: Booked and paid for a room with a view. Unfortuanately the room was on the ground floor so not much of a view. Reasonable breakfast however the breakfast room was a very small room with only two tables inside. Tables outside which would have been perfect if it was warm and sunny. Excellent shuttle service to and from the airport. Shuttle will also take you to station at the airport for travel into the city.
review.positiveRemarks: Shuttle service to and from the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Dining room very small
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport. 30 minutes by train from the city.

review.title: Really good place to stay!
review.reviewText:
Out of all the continental breakfasts i have had at other hotels. This has been the best by far!
They had eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, breads, and even waffles with strawberries and whip cream. Their coffee was great as well. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.
And it was a great price!

review.title: Mini vacation
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice . Located by the bay and at a walking distance from two well known restaurants. Staff were nice and friendly. Not the best location if you are wanting to visit fishermans warf.
review.locationRemarks: If you want to visit San Francisco, this is not the best location.

review.title: Hidden gem
review.reviewText: Great Breakfast - mostly good people. With airport shuttle and good pricing, directly next to two busy restaurants it always a stop when I travel to the bay area.

review.title: Would stay at this location again
review.reviewText: Good location since it's near the airport and highway 101. It appears to be an older facility but has been fairly well maintained. A couple of Restaurants are within a stones throw and a gas station is just down the street. Looks like some rooms have a water views and the breakfast has a good variety (Not just coffee and donuts as some places provide)
review.positiveRemarks: The distance to Airport is great.
review.negativeRemarks: Could use some updating and I hate using parking passes.

review.title: Nice and simple.
review.reviewText: The View was exactly what was promised. Very few vending machines and had no idea where they were including the ice. But the room service rest. was open till 3 am and took credit upon delievery which was convinient. The elevator wasnt working, that wasnt bad even tho we were on the 3rd floor.I wasnt very informed about the area or how far all the San Fran attractions really were. but overall it wasnt bad at all.
review.negativeRemarks: Info about anything. Elevator broken
review.locationRemarks: Farther away from downtown then informed.

review.title: foul smell, no air
review.reviewText: The air conditioning didnt work, it blew out hot air only. room smelled like ciagerrets

review.title: do not judge the book by the cover
review.reviewText: a most unpreposing building with rather poor access exterior to all rooms and the rooms facing the car park did not look very interesting but the back rooms facing the bay were quiet comfortable and most pleasant ...nothing flashy but good for a nice sleep
review.negativeRemarks: the bus jointly going 2 other hotels takes more than the 30 minute intervals
review.locationRemarks: very good ..on the water and 5 minutes from SFO

review.title: ok
review.reviewText: this is not to much to say.....I stay just one night......but was very good.
review.negativeRemarks: every body is 100%
review.locationRemarks: very good location....near almost to every thing...restaurant, airport, freeway...etcc

review.title: Clean, convenient and affordable.
review.reviewText:
This hotel worked well for airport convenience. The shuttle runs approx every 20 mins. Friendly check-in and check-out were breezes. I had room #114 on the ground floor with easy access to the parking lot, lobby and coastal walking trail. This room has NO patio/balcony as most others facing the water do.

The bed was firmly comfortable, not sagging or lumpy. Everything seemed clean and tidy. The noise from the airport rattled the windows till maybe 1am, but I didn't mind. The tv was flat screen with Direct TV.

Breakfast area is a tight squeeze with limited seating. The selection is decent with hot items [waffles, scrambled eggs, sausages and potatoes], as well as breads, muffins, apples, yogurts, coffee and tea. Wifi is free and easy, plus there are two computers in the breakfast area for guest use.
review.positiveRemarks: I slept really well in the comfy bed.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was not well-insulated against the cold.
review.locationRemarks: There are a few restaurants within walking distance, and bus stops within a block each way.

review.title: Multi-day business stay
review.reviewText: Hotel was generally great - outside doors a little loose in closing and outside walls thin - wind kept shaking them. But nice staff, comfortable room, good amenities for the price, nice location.
review.positiveRemarks: free breakfast, tea & coffee all hours, bedding comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: heating system didn't work well, wind shook the windows a LOT
review.locationRemarks: good location

review.title: staff
review.reviewText: One thing i noticed is that the staff was amazing - very friendly and helpful.
review.locationRemarks: location is amazing. the shore is just literally two steps away.

review.title: Mediocre Experience
review.reviewText:
When I arrived, there was no one in the office and no note on the door saying where someone working there was. I waited for about 5 minutes outside in the cold wondering if I was going to be able to check in before someone arrived. When she did, she didn't say a word to us and had a hard time figuring out how to give us the room we had a reservation for. I would stay there again though because of the price, free breakfast, free wi-fi and free parking.

The other thing that was weird was that the lights in the room have sensors, so the light went off on me about 3 times while I was taking a shower and went on as I was going to bed and my friend was already trying to sleep.
review.negativeRemarks: Less than friendly staff
review.locationRemarks: Location was great for where I needed to go. Waterfront is close and beautiful.

review.title: Room was too cold, staff unfriendly
review.reviewText: We got the outermost room along the waterfront which did not have proper heat insulation and only single panel glass doors facing the waterfront. The room was too cold all of our stay in February. The receptionist was not very helpful or friendly either. I will not stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: No heat insulation, unfriendly front-desk staff.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText:
Location is definitely the middle of nowhere, but close enough to the airport (~15minutes from hotel to airport; somewhat faster going to the hotel due to the stops the shuttle has to make on the way to the airport). Some view of the water, and there's a nice terrace for breakfast, though it overlooks the road. Breakfast is great; rooms were just fine, with a microwave and a desk, plus free wifi with no annoying password. Great deal for the price.

Perfect if you happen to have a conference like I did at the nearby Marriott, which cost 3x as much and is a very short walk away.
review.positiveRemarks: Free Hot breakfast (waffles, eggs, sausage) and free fruit + tea/coffee all day
review.negativeRemarks: Limited staff -- had to wait to be buzzed in when arriving around 10pm while staff member came back from an errand. Only happened once though.
review.locationRemarks: A bit out of the way. Hotel-airport shuttle is not direct; has to go through other hotels. Eating breakfast outside on their "terrace" is nice though

review.title: Unclean
review.reviewText: Carpet in the room had settled-in compact filth. Can't walk barefoot. You can feel the dirty carpet.
review.negativeRemarks: Room carpet was filthy
review.locationRemarks: Good location

review.title: Nice room, nice breakfast, nice price.
review.reviewText: The first room they sent us to was not ready, the next room was. The room was very clean and nice. The only problem we had was operating the thermostate, might have been our fault. We would stay here again.

review.title: Clean and Comfortable
review.reviewText:
This hotel is nicely located near the San Francisco airport. It is very clean and comfortable.
The staffs are very kind and the breakfast is good. It also provides frree riding between the airport and the hotel. It was a little bit noisy at night. I could hear some voices at night.

review.title: I will stay there again!
review.reviewText: This is a good hotel, close to restaurants, and is clean & quiet. There is a nice path along the bay behind the property. The complimentary breakfast is well stocked and you can make your own waffles. You can leave your car there for a week at a minimal cost and there is a free shuttle to SFO.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Near the SF bay and close to SFO.

review.title: San Francisco Vacation
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly and accomodating. Allowed us to Check in Early (9:30 am) which was very much appreciated. The deluxe breakfast is awesome.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendliness of the Staff, cleanliness and the Deluxe Breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Easy on and off access to the Highway and Airport

review.title: Heading home from Pebble Beach and golf!
review.reviewText:
Arrived with a friend to spend one night as we were flying out early next day. The beds were very nice and the room was better than expected for the price. Shuttle runs every 30 minutes, leaves 6:33 am; 7:03 am etc. from hotel. Shuttle pick up at the airport was fine becasuse there was A SFO person there with knowledge of the schedule and he was nice. Cookies on arrival around 7:00 pm but disappeared fast--they were good.
If I were single and by myself I would probably not stay there. However, saying that there were families with children there and clientele seemed okay. Elephant Bar next door was busy but did not venture to see it. No real food on the premises.
review.positiveRemarks: Cookies and computer with printer. (Boarding Pass)
review.negativeRemarks: TV was not up to date.
review.locationRemarks: About 15 minutes from the airport.

review.title: My new go-to hotel when in SF
review.reviewText: When at SFO, I typically stay at the Best Western in South San Francisco. I decided to give the Vagabond a shot since Best Western was full and the Vagabond is now going to be my go-to hotel. The rooms are great, you can walk over to downtown Burlingame in about 15 minutes (train station is there) and there is a nice walking trail along the bay right next to the hotel. The free airport shuttle is a huge plus and the breakfast is great.

review.title: I really like it here.
review.reviewText:
My husband and I stay at this hotel anytime we need to be in San Francisco, mainly because we don't like driving in the city and there is a free shuttle to the airport and we can take the Bart into town. Of course the people that run this place are only human so they do make some mistakes. The room is always nice, BUT, if you don't like the sound of planes, then don't stay next to an airport.

Breakfast is pretty good, waffles, eggs, sausage, country potatoes and of course the usual cereal, muffins bagels, etc. Breakfast is only from 6-9 just as a heads up you need to get up early for the free breakfast. They have free coffee, tea, juice and hot chocolate at all times and sometimes cookies.

I will stay there next time I am in town.

review.title: Location for my purpose was good. Bay view room was a good choice
review.reviewText: The location was good for my business trip. I used to stay at this motel over 35 years ago and this was my first visit back. I don't think they have updated the place since I was last there. The wi fi in the room did not work. I had to go to the lobby to get on the internet to do my work. This was not helpful. The breakfast area was very small but the food was fine. The staff were very nice and the parking was good and also free. Lot's of good places to eat within a couple of minutes of the motel. I think is was a good value for the price and I would use the Vagabond again for my business trip. Not good for a honeymoon however.

review.title: right by the highway, slow internet with very high decor, not much kitchen though
review.reviewText:
The place is right by the highway so make sure room is away from the noise. The mall, grocery store, theater are all just literally steps away. The Internet access is painstakingly slow. The rooms have been remodeled with very upscale furniture, spa soap, new carpets, etc.
Can clearly hear other guests TV and vibration of walking from the above floor. There is plenty of windows, the curtains do a great job of muffling the sound so the highway was not a major concern. The shower pressure was mediocre, the heating in the room is a really old gas fireplace, with a bit of smell but still acceptable.

The kitchenette is just that, no stove, but the microwave allows for heating up a soup. There is kitchen table with 2 chairs.

The hotel staff was nice.

The room felt very open with great morning sun if you are facing the theater.

review.title: Great Place To Stay For A Great Price
review.reviewText: Stayed here when I came to visit my girlffiend. Nice friendly hotel staff and the room was kept clean. The continental breakfast was adequate. Sure beats having to pay for breakfast. It was nice to have a fridge and microwave in the room as well as the free WiFi. Would absolutely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone.

review.title: Comfortable Bed, Great Breakfast
review.reviewText: The Vagabond Inn near the SFO Airport was a great value! The king bed was comfortable, the room was clean, and the free deluxe breakfast was great! Will definitely go back, if we need a hotel near the SFO Airport again! Benihana's and Elephant Bar are close by too!

review.title: ok for the price and convenience
review.reviewText:
pros
close to airport , good breakfast free parking.

cons
bathroom ceiling and tub was not in very good condition

review.title: Gets the job done
review.reviewText: I think this hotel met and exceeded my expectations as far location and amenities go. I picked it becasue it was close to the airport/Bart and it had a refrigerator/microwave in the room. Also, the breakfast is awesome except it ends at 9am. The only exception to my satisfaction is that on my 2nd night, the Dish service went out in my room and when I called the front desk to get it fixed the woman basically offerred me no help. The satellite came back on somtime the next day but the customer service was unacceptable. Also, my phone stopped working the morning of my checkout. All in all, I would stay again because I really like the location and the amenities (when they work).
review.locationRemarks: I like Burlingame because it is easy to get to the city and the south or east bay. Downtown Burlingame is small but has the expected little eateries and stores. Fortunately, there is an Elephant Bar and Benihana really close if you need a more upbeat dining experience since the town is pretty quiet.

review.title: Convenient to airport
review.reviewText: Used motel to stay one night prior to flying out of SFO. Our wake-up call came promptly at 4:00 am and shuttle runs every half hour to airport. Even though complimentary breakfast wasn't offered until 6:00 am, there was hot coffee as well as bananas and other fruit at 4:00 am. Room was comfortable and clean and front staff friendly and helpful. Can't speak to any other amenities as we were there for less than six hours and that was spent sleeping. We did appreciate having night stands on both sides of the bed.

review.title: Convenient & worth the price
review.reviewText: Convenient to SFO and worth the price
review.locationRemarks: The Birlingame area was close to the airport and provided easy access to major highways.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Noisy but OK for one night before an early flight out or after landing late

review.title: "Hotel Surprisingly Clean"
review.reviewText:
Enjoyed our stay at Vagabond with the free continental breakfast (altho the room with only 2 tables set up for breakfast is small & crowded-hard to move around), free internet, free parking and free airport shuttle were great. The older elevator very slow, small and need to be updated. When in San Francisco, will visit Burlingame again, especially the easy access to and from the airport.

Aloha,
Lei from Hawaii
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Cable Car Ride, Shopping at Ghiradelli and the malls.

review.title: Koolness
review.reviewText: Hotel was very easy to get to especially next to the airport, literally 5minutes away. Everything was good but as mentioned the furniture was kinda old and outta date, besides that the view was good and no complaints what so ever, I would definitely go back again.

review.title: Excellent value
review.reviewText: An excellent little hotel

review.title: Poor Service
review.reviewText: The front desk service is not froendly. I paid extra money for the bay view room. But I got the first floor room. The fence block half of window. Actually, it is not the view. I'm sure the view from second and third floors must be very good. The next room is the storage room whixh is dark and dirty. I won't be back anytime.

review.title: Back again and just as happy
review.reviewText: This is my second stay at the Vagabond Inn. My daughter wanted to come back here for the last night before my flight out of the city - we even got the same Bay View room. The beds are so cozy and comfortable, it is almost impossible to leave them in the morning to get on with the day. Check-in was seamless and fast, the front desk always very helpful. Breakfast is always plentiful and fresh, the server makes sure all the food is replenished. The breakfast room could be a bit larger to accommodate more guests comfortably. Not so much the seating as there is ample seating outside, but to make it easier for several folks to get their food without wait. Also, the toaster should be upgraded to a 4-slice machine, perhaps add another. This is so not a deal breaker for me, just thought I would let you at the hotel have my opinion about this part. The location is beautiful, outdoors there is a wide path the length of a very long block, great for walking, jogging. And right on the Bay, you can stand at the wall and watch the planes take off and land. If I ever needed to stay in San Francisco near the airport again, I would go back in a heartbeat!

review.title: Room to hot and no way to cool it down.
review.reviewText: The room was too hot. (Late October) The front desk said the temp was controlled automatically. So the second night I opened the front window and left it open all night to cool to down. Then I woke up at 0300 wondering if that was a good idea from the security standpoint.

review.title: SFO Airport's Best B&B
review.reviewText: If you're looking for a good night's sleep after a long flight landing in SFO and want to wake up to some of the best complimentary breakfasts and Belgian waffles in the area, then look not further. Very impressed with our hotel stay in the US and as 1st timers didn't know what to expect in an Inn, but this place was very clean and comforting. Location was brilliant, a few minutes (1&1/2 mile) and a ten dollar taxi from San Fran airport. (the hotel also runs its own shuttle to/from the airport but we couldn't wait for it). Overlooking the bay and right next door to very chic Elephant bar therefore offering lots of dinner choices. The staff was very friendly and helpful to me - a 1st time tourist to the US (been to family's home before but never to a US hotel). Was great overall, very highly recommend it
review.locationRemarks: Golden Gate, Fisherman's Wharf, San Fran Cable Cars, Union Square

review.title: Would stay again...
review.reviewText: Very comfortable. Close to airport but not too noisy.

review.title: Not so good stay
review.reviewText: After booking the room on line, believe me the pictures on line need to be updated to show thw appearence of the hotel now. California was going through an extremely hot spell and after we arrived found out the air conditioning in the room did not work. The doors have about a 1 inch cap to the outside so the room was extremely hot. We called the hotel desk to inform them of the situation they stated that they were sold out and that they would not compensate us for the inconvienence of sweltering to death in our own room. After another call to the front desk they did finally bring us a fan. The non smoking rooms sound great except for this is an outside hotel so all the guest smoke standing outside their rooms all day and then go into the room, really non-smoking. Outside is extremely loud do to the fact they are next to public access were everybody talks on their phones. Would not stay here with small children or valuables. Next time will spend extra money to stay in different hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Burlingame is fine just further down the road. Hilton, Marriot, Holiday Inn Express.

review.title: Great for airport layover; will return on my way home
review.reviewText: This is a wonderful place to stay if you need to have some sort of layover in San Francisco. We had a bay view room which was lovely Breakfast was very good, and lots of food for all ages. The staff were friendly and helpful. Shuttle was on time and courteous. Truthfully, I was surprised at how much I liked the whole experience.

review.title: Good Place to stay if in transit
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay the only thing was I had to wait on both occasions up to 2 hours before I could get a room.
review.locationRemarks: N/A

review.title: Not expected so good
review.reviewText: I thought the hotel was not so good because of the name. Hotel is perfect. Surroundings are nice, many restaurants around, nice view. Just the breakfast too crowd, not much space.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's warf

review.title: will be nack
review.reviewText: Very clean, comfortable and convenient. Awesome breakfast!

review.title: No thank you
review.reviewText: I am normally ok with mediocre room, I do not have to be overly impressed with it's conditions, but this room was dirty. I found a hair and dirt between the sheets and from that point on I just could not trust any cleanliness of the place.

review.title: Good bargain
review.reviewText: A decent b&b...could be improved if they polished the furniture, but otherwise clean and appropriate for the price.

review.title: Good price but not well maintain
review.reviewText: hard to find that price at this area but the room is not so clean, mainly cause of dust

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText:
Staff was friendly and helpful but room was very disappointing. It had an unpleasant odor that was present throughout our entire stay. Bathroom ceiling tiles were water-stained with areas of mold/mildew. Otherwise, room was clean with comfortable beds.

Very close to airport, with a nice walking path along the water, but a pricey cab ride to downtown San Francisco.

review.title: Cant go back!
review.reviewText: For the price paid I was expecting much more. Old hotel, clean rooms.

review.title: OK for business trip
review.reviewText: what makes this place different from other Hotels is their 24hour refreshment service in the lobby.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: My wife and I found the location on the edge of the bay suited our every need, most days we watched at some time the huge amount of bird life catching their fish and the planes landing at the airport, Also the use of the free shuttle bus every day to the train was most welcome and cost saving, although we always tipped the drivers for excellent service. Overall our visit to San Francisco was a lovely experience.

review.title: Good hotel for SFO
review.reviewText: My wife and I often travel through SFO and always have early starts. We were very pleased with Vagabond, the room was spotless and the bed extremely comfortable. The location is excellent for the airport and the shuttle service punctual and efficient. This has become our preferred place to stay when we fly from SFO.

review.title: Great hotel for a great price
review.reviewText: Great location. Right next to the SFO Airport which not only makes for an easy trip to and from, but also makes for great view. Don't worry, it's not loud at all. The hotel is backed up to the bay which also has a great view and is very relaxing. There's a sidewalk that runs right behind it that leads from one end to the other and passe's through many nice restaurants etc. The room had a king bed which is great for 2 people unless someone doesn't mind sleeping on the floor. There would be space for 1-2 more that way. The bathroom is a little out dated, but still clean. The sink etc is located outside the room so if someone is trying to sleep, that maybe a disadvantage. The general layout of the hotel is nice. It has a more vacation feel like you're in a time share vs. just staying in a hotel. Rooms are easy to get to with elevators access. Vending machines are stocked. Parking is easy and close. With the parking permits they issue you, it keeps others from taking up space. Laundary is available too. I didn't eat breakfast there, but they did have a nice set up. It's not huge so if there are tons of people at the same time, that may be a problem, but looks comfortable. There are (3) waffle makers, tons of beverages, and all your standard stuff. Very clean and kept up. The lobby is relaxing to. Not a ton of traffice. Overall I would say it's a 4 or so. For the price, location, view, service, it's great. Very close to the 101.

review.title: Vagabond
review.reviewText: Used as a hotel to catch a flight out of SF

review.title: convenient for air port - well priced
review.reviewText:
beautiful view from bay front rooms

mexican restaurant El Torito nearby was OK -- not great - but close -also with great view of the bay

review.title: Hot and crowded
review.reviewText:
The HVAC system simply did not ventilate or cool the room.
The breakfast area had two tables and was extremely cramped.

review.title: Free parking can't be beat...
review.reviewText: ...and also the fact that it is right on the water; the shore is literally five steps outside your room (that is, if you pay for a bayview room). I would suggest requesting a bayview room on the second or third level, because with the public shorewalk running right past the first floor rooms' patios, it almost feels like you're staying in a fish bowl (especially if you trying to have privacy while at the same time keeping the shades open for the view of the bay). No other complaints about the room/service really.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: I reserved a room with a bay view. I got a bay view but I was no the bottom floor and my room butted up to the walkway where people (lots of people) walk for exercise. There is a small patio outside the door but no chairs or anything to sit on and there was trash in the planters. Bathroom was dirty and tub did not drain. Thank goodness I was just staying one night. Won't stay here again!

review.title: Close to the airport.
review.reviewText: We had an early morning flight and this place fit the bill, they transported us back after we dropped off our car rental, wake up call woke us up and shuttle got us back to the airport. Clean and comfortable room.

review.title: Happy staying at Vagabond Inn Executive San Francisco Airport
review.reviewText: Clean roon. Great view. Convenience location with free shuttle service to/from the airport. Very good continental breakfast service. Will go back again.

review.title: Not too bad for the money
review.reviewText: This is my third stay here in a year. Location is good and it's nice being close to the water. The guest services are bad everytime. Last staff member never even made eye contact- wondered why she asked to see my ID when it's obvious she didn't acknowledge my identity. Do not stay on the third floor bayview side. The windows are single pain and was constantly worried about my kids falling out since it was single pane and no screens

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel met our needs of price, location, cleanliness. Good breakfast and restaurants nearby.

review.title: excellent
review.reviewText: very happy with the breakfast. I loved the sausage and egg biscuit. the room was small but comfortable. perfect for the ocasion. the view from some rooms is great. it was worth the price.

review.title: Clean, but extremely outdated.
review.reviewText: This hotel was fine if you don't need A/C & you don't care about antiquated furniture. I don't think you could even call it A/C - it was like a fan in the wall, that's how old it is. Thank goodness the window opened because even with the A/C on High, it was unbearably warm. The furniture was worn and probably 20 or more years old. It was a clean place though and it offers free Wi-Fi. I guess that's why they call it Executive. With all the hotels on that block - and all of them renovated - I can't imagine how they stay in business.

review.title: Not Impressed and staffs of hotel are not that friendly.
review.reviewText: I would rather not go this hotel again...

review.title: Beautiful View of the Water
review.reviewText: The hotel locaiton is wonderful. It is right off the water, I believe that the hotel would be a better place if they steam cleaned the carpets and made sure all linen is clean. The breakfast was good and had variety. The person at the desk was polite and informative.

review.title: Free parking! Easy to find! Low traffic! Some noise!
review.reviewText:
Important to know before you visit...
- Free parking and plenty of it
- Right off the freeway and easy to get to
- Not much traffic to deal with
- The room was clean enough and comfortable.
- The breakfast room is tiny for how many guests are in the hotel. Don't eat at the last minute, or you may not eat.
- There is a wonderful walkway that runs along the waterfront. Great for a walk or jog. It's clean, no trash, and I felt safe in the morning when I went out.
- 18 minute drive from the hotel to my son's appt in the heart of S.F.

On the negative side....
- Because its located right next to the Elephant Bar and El Toritos, we experienced late-night loudness by guests that apparently had been out and then didn't care if their 3am outside loudness and door slamming bothered other guests. Both Friday and Saturday nights I was awakened multiple times. (Especially frustrating because I had to be up at 5:30am for an 8 hour drive home.)

review.title: Vagabond San Fran
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and the bed was perfect. The continental breakfast was good and it is close to the airport with free shuttle service

review.title: Great location for SFO airport
review.reviewText: stayed there for a quick overnight...great location to airport...also some family restaurants within walking distance...

review.title: Will go back
review.reviewText: Great location (close to airport and next to bay shore --- can't beat that). The best thing I like about this hotel is its complimentary breakfast. It provides self-made waffle, sausage links and patties, eggs (boiled and scrambled)... I couldn't find such breakfast in other expensive hotels. I will definitely go back to this hotel next time when I visit San Francisco.

review.title: based on reviews
review.reviewText: I have made a new habit of booking hotels based on reviews. I am really glad I started doing this after some of the experiences I have had traveling. I loved this hotel! There was a warm, friendly vibe, clean rooms, free shuttle to the air port, free breakfast and a great rate. There was a well-lit walkway behind the hotel that led to some restaurants. Also a really cool view of planes taking off and landing over a stretch of water that ran behind the hotel. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to any one I know that is flying into or out of the SFO airport.

review.title: Close to Elephant Bar
review.reviewText:
Our room was nice and clean upon available. We were a little disappointed that the ice machine was not working. We wanted our room a little cooler and the air cooler seemed to not be working either.

We love the location of the hotel...right by Elephant Bar....the price is right for our budget at this time.

We hope that the hotel will maintain their property better.....

review.title: Just right!
review.reviewText: Just what i needed for a simple quick stay.

review.title: Solid choice
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were pleasant, helpful and efficient. Thebreakfast - particularly the waffles was more than adequate. Close to the ariport. Shuttle service is frequent and ontime.

review.title: What a nice cosy place
review.reviewText: I did not expect much considering that the hotel was quite reasonably priced but i was pleasently suprised! The room was clean and comfortable. I love the fact that they provide a microwave and fridge- these are essential to travellers! The breakfast was standard with a variety atleast. I would recomment staying here if you are on a budget - its value fior your money. I just wish it were closer to stuff that tourists want to do but the train system worked well

review.title: BEST AIRPORT HOTEL
review.reviewText:
Nothing but good news about this hotel. Clean, spacious rooms and quiet location for resting before a flight. Fantastic breakfast, best complimentary breakfast I have ever seen. Staff is friendly and professional. 2 great restaurants next door.

I will stay here every time I have a layover in San Francisco.

Thank you for keeping up the quality.

review.title: The Price is Right
review.reviewText: If you're not looking for an overpriced hotel room then this place is great! It's not centrally located near anything but it's finally a cheap hotel room in the San Fran area and there are restaurants close by. The free breakfast is wonderful! Having free internet access and not paying for parking is great too! The hotel rooms are clean, a little outdated, but definitely not a dump and the hotel staff is very courteous. The free shuttle is a heaven send too so you can get to your hotel anytime during the day and most of the night. I spent 7 nights there and enjoyed it my whole stay.

review.title: Good stay for the weekend
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel for the weekend, the room was nice and confortable. The only reason why I gave it a 3 in maintenance is because when room service came it was so early and I asked them to come back. We were gone the whole day and when we came back, the room was not cleaned; room service never came back!

review.title: Very good deal !
review.reviewText: The Hotel is really good for his price! I enjoyed it!

review.title: No frills but convenient to SF Airport
review.reviewText: The room was clean and convenient to restaurants and our rental location. We were on the 2nd level and the room was very warm in January. The vent fan only put out heated air, not cool or outside vented air. Nothing fancy but it fit the bill and very reasonable in price in order for us to get shuttled to the SF airport for a morning flight.

review.title: good value for money.
review.reviewText: Too far away from San Francisco but not bad if you want to stay near the airport.

review.title: Great value for your money
review.reviewText: It was great. they had a deluxe continental breakfast, which you could make your own waffles. fresh fruit, and other things. They had free wi-fi in the rooms and a computer in the lobby u could use free of charge. microwave and fridge in the rooms. Very clean and comfortable rooms. close to the freeway and airport.

review.title: Great value!
review.reviewText: Room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was good, the attendant kept everything restocked as needed, but seating was very limited. A very pleasant stay, I would say there again.

review.title: HUH?
review.reviewText: SEE ABOVE!

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: Easy to hear noise from the next room, but a good value.

review.title: ok for business traveller,
review.reviewText:
I am a repeat customer avg booking 40 nites a year for the last 20 years, I requested room on 3rd floor, but was given 1st floor .. I can see many king rooms are not checking in on the upper floor, but agent do not even want to take a look to honor my request to do a room switch. A take it or leave it attitude. I think I deserve a better treatment than those one nighter just to catch a early flight.
I ask the agent if the hotel has wifi now, she told me there is connection on thephone. Turn our to be a phone jack to use with 56k modem. What a joke!! Next day the morning clerk told me there are wifi installed on two place, but there was no signal detacted in my room. Luck me in a dead zone.

review.title: Best Pre-Flight Hotel in Area
review.reviewText:
We've using this hotel for pre-flight overnite out of SFO numerous times.
It's always reasonable-priced, convenient, easy shuttle service, long term parking, continental breakfast, and right next door to Elephant Bar and El Torito for late nite snacks or dinner. Have stayed in others but this is best value for the dollar and staff is very accomodating.

review.title: Fine for Staying Overnight
review.reviewText: The front desk clerk at night was personable and tried to be helpful. However, the morning clerk was not at all helpful and had a very uncaring attitude. The room was okay and seemed clean. The bed was comfortable and I slept well. Maintenance could be improved: One of the lights in the room did not work and the computer printer in the lobby furnished to the guests did not print. For the price, it was fine and I will probably stay there again.

review.title: Very good motel. We'd stay there again.
review.reviewText: Very convenient for travelers. We were picked up at airport by shuttle with no delays. Good service and breakfast.

review.title: Avoid it like the plague!
review.reviewText: This place was a disaster - avoid it at all costs! There's no in room (controllable) air conditioning, so when I checked in at 10pm and my room was over 85 degrees, they said there wasn't anything that could be done about it. The same thing occurred each night. The breakfast buffet was also terrible. Pay a little more and get something decent.

review.title: The Three 'C's'.
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel as it was conveniently located close to SFO (arrived into SF at midnight after a long flight with two children). We had an RV booked for the next day and this hotel was one of the few that the RV company's shuttle collected from. The hotel was clean, comfortable and convenient. As it was an early pick up, the complimentary breakfast was great. Wonderful views of San Fran Bay.

review.title: Great place, not too fancy, but did the job nicely.
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel and rode the BART to the Giants game and it worked out perfectly. There is free parking at the hotel so if you don't mind riding into the city to save about $30 it is well worth it. It is close to the BART station, and there are several restaraunts within walking distance. It is nothing fancy, but neither is the price. It is a nice place! My only problem was the mattress was a little too hard for me but that will be different for everyone I guess.

review.title: Mediocore
review.reviewText: if you need a room for the night, fine place to stay. Near the highways and shopping, decent breakfast, clean room- overall it's average. Not bad considering what you pay for staying in the city. Quiet area near the airport.

review.title: Good service, clean room, old hotel
review.reviewText: I had to be in San Francisco the same week as the Oracle conference, and finding a room was nearly impossible. All hotels in the area seem to jack up their rates for that week, and I'm guessing I paid more than twice the usual rate. The service was good, I found the people at the front desk to be very nice and willing to help/answer questions, etc. The room itself was just ok ... had a bay view, which was nice, but doors are open to the outside (so motel vs. hotel), which isn't my preference as being a woman traveling alone it felt sort of creepy coming in at night. The room was clean (no nasty rug stains, didn't smell like disinfectant), but the room and furniture were clearly old and not of the quality you'd find at, say, a Hampton Inn, where everything always feels updated. The free breakfast was good, do-it-yourself belgian waffles and the usual continental breakfast type stuff. Real close to the airport, which was fine except I had to travel to downtown via cab every day which ran between $45-$55 per ride one-way. I didn't try the two restaurants within walking distance because I didn't find them particularly appealing, would be nice if there were some more choices nearby. Would also have liked it if there were some sort of convenience store within walking distance. Overall, not a horrible place to stay, but if you're picky about appearances or don't like a place that feels "old", you probably won't like this place.

review.title: Smelly, noisy, and hot, oh yeah...rude and definitely OVERPRICED.
review.reviewText: If I had a check list on how NOT to run business " The Vagabond Executive Inn San Francisco Airport" would be a primer. The air conditioning did not work for two days but did put out incredible noise. The clerks were rude and afraid to make any decisions. I was supposed to have a smoke free room but it smelled like a bar. Never was I offered any courtesy as is the case in any serve based situation when the CUSTOMER is inconvenienced. After the fact, I called the regional office and was advised to contact the manager. This proved even more frustrating because the manager took an incredibly aggressive defensive posture. She inferred that both my wife and myself had lied regarding the smell and air. Her rational was that they were always full therefore I must be full of beans. Well maybe the fact that they are located five minutes from the airport and can get away with the horrible overpriced accommodations on unsuspecting people like us might be what she was alluding to. Excuse me but where does the customer fit in her equation. I think this little tid bit of insight says it all. My wife and I were provided with two small bars of soap and no bath towels. See what I mean...save a few pennies on cheap amenities because we have a herd mentality. Who cares if we provide rude shoddy service, planes full of people come and go. Well, sorry to be a little spur in your philosophy. I work for my money and the very least I can expect is courtesy and minimally the service I payed for.

review.title: Best bargain near the airport
review.reviewText: Very convenient to the airport, good neighborhood, great beds, and GREAT complimentary breakfast. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Nice hotel near of airport
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel, very clean, free parking. The breakfast was ok: juice, milk, wafles, eggs, coffe, tea, toast bread; a tipical american breakfast.
Close to San Francisco, aprox. 20 minutes!

review.title: Not the worst, but not very good
review.reviewText: The only good comment I can make about this place is the breakfast - it is not too bad at all. At least the bed linens and towels were clean. However, I wouldn't stay here again.

review.title: Nice, near the airport hotel.
review.reviewText:
Nice and clean hotel, near the airport.

It was nice for us, that wanted only a night near the airport. It's far from San Francisco atractions.

review.title: Nice and Cozy
review.reviewText:
The place was very convenient, located near SFO. The Millbrae BART station is relatively close as well. I work in San Francisco and live across the bay, so this was a nice place to stay for a weekend when I had events going on in SF and did not want to go home after work, then having to come back out the next day. Price is reasonable, includes breakfast. There was also a refrigerator and microwave in the room, that was nice. Having a computer with printer available, also very nice and helpful since I had forgotten to print out a ticket. Big plus!

Being close to the airport is convenient, but those who are sensitive to sound might not be able to sleep-in due to the planes flying over the place (it did not bother me, though). I would definitely use this place again. Thank you!

review.title: great overall value.
review.reviewText: Quite clean...very friendly service, convenient location , trust this location and enjoy!

review.title: Bad Service, Great BED!
review.reviewText: So the service here sucked.. But my boyfriend and I fell asleep very comfortably on their bed. That's what we enjoyed most about the hotel. It was nice to walk along the path and look at the views too, but the employees are the first thing you encounter at a hotel, and I wasn't very happy from the beginning so my stay here overall was still only average.

review.title: Great Location.
review.reviewText: Bayside rooms were Noisy, Overlooking theairport landing strips. Changed to another room, and slept great. They need to expand the breakfast area. It was crowded every day, any time.

review.title: satisfied
review.reviewText: Nice, budget hotel. Excleent breakfast. Good access to SFO and to BART for visits to San Francisco

review.title: A fair price for a fair hotel
review.reviewText:
We were looking for something in the airport vicinity that had 2 queen beds without paying a fortune. This hotel was clean and worth the money. A bit noisy due to the rooms all opening to the outside. Right on the water by the airport, but the airplane noise did not bother us. Another advantage is they do not charge for parking. Most hotels in the area charge an additional $10-$15 per day to park, which jacks up their rates.
If you are looking for a clean place to stay while visiting the area, this is good place for the money.

review.title: Good value for money
review.reviewText: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel. It is clean, comfortable for the price you pay. If you don't want to spend lots on a hotel and not cheap as motel 6, this hotel is ideal. If you have a car, restaurants are only 5 minutes away.

review.title: Great for the night
review.reviewText: It's perfect for a nights stay. Very comfortable. I slept really well.

review.title: CAME FROM PA FOR THE RAIDERS!!!
review.reviewText: WE WILL BE STAYING AT THIS HOTEL AGAIN NEXT FOOTBALL SEASON!!

review.title: Great Location and Price
review.reviewText: The Vagabond Inn Executive is in a great location near the airport and we were very satisfied with the price we paid. We paid a little extra for a room that had a little balcony that looked out over the Bay and we could watch the planes take off and land. We enjoyed that. The room was a bit dated and worn, but had a wonderful bed that was very comfortable and a nice flat screen TV. The breakfast in the lobby was better than we expected. Overall, we were very satisfied and will stay here again on our next trip to San Francisco.

review.title: Fine for a quick stopover
review.reviewText: A fine choice for a quick overnight while passing though SFO.

review.title: Not so great
review.reviewText: My family stayed at this hotel for a fun weekend in the city recently. I have to say, I was not only not impressed, I was a little frustrated. The clerk made many mistakes, and then I found out he was new. Plus, he upgraded us to a better room, so that was ok. The elevator was broken the entire weekend. The breakfast was ok, but there were only 2 tables with 2 chairs each, so my girl had to eat her cereal standing up!

review.title: Not a good stay
review.reviewText: Had to change room 3 times... faulty doors ands locks, crumbling baseboards, no restaurant as advertised.

review.title: Great for the price. Central location for all the attractions of San Fran
review.reviewText: Great services such as complimentary breakfast and shuttle service to the airport.

review.title: Airplanes galore
review.reviewText: This hotel is a secret gem if you like airplanes and watching them at sfo. It is comfortable and adquate for a stay in the bay area.

review.title: Would recommend - average price.
review.reviewText: This hotel was very pleasant to stay in. Clean and spacious. Comfortable king side bed! Free internet access and complimentry drinks and fruit in reception. Ideal only 5 mins from SFO airport.

review.title: Exactly what I needed!
review.reviewText: I needed a hotel that was close to the airport as I had to spend 1 night in San Francisco for a connecting flight the next day. The free shuttle and breakfast was perfect for what I needed. However you can hear the planes at night although this did not distract me from having a good nights sleep. I have been to San Francisco before and stayed further in town which is ideal for a vacation. But for an overnight stay I would recommend this hotel!

review.title: Price is Right
review.reviewText: Very good hotel and the WiFi works if there isn't too many people using it. I love their breakfast but you have to get up early, before 10 AM to get the good stuff. Coffee and juice is available all day so fill up your mugs before you go. I would stay here again if the price is low but most of the time it is expensive.

review.title: I will be back!
review.reviewText: Not only was I very happy with the excellent service provided by Jason and the hotel's closeness to the airport, I was able to leave my car at the hotel for a reasonable fee while I went on my vaction. Their breakfast is as good as always and they have computer access in lobby so I could do my advance check in which helped save time at airport.

review.title: Like a second home
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel about 4 times now. The staff has remained pretty much the same each time. They are freindly, they have yummy waffles for breakfast. I ride the BART when I want to go somewhere, and I always was able to take the Airport shuttle right to the BART station at the airport, and call for the shuttle when I got back and I would get a ride back. Its less expensive than the large luxury hotels down the street, but just as comfortable and nice. Free wi fi too.

review.title: Not so good
review.reviewText: not good.do not recommend.

review.title: very comfortable, great location, easy to find
review.reviewText: I loved where the location was, only 10 minutes from the Fishermans wharf and downtown. Loved the continental breakfast and free parking. Friendly staff. Close to the freeway.

review.title: weekend in SF
review.reviewText: Great value- excellent breakfast, comfortable room, clean and quiet. Recommended.

review.title: Our Choice of Hotels Near SFO
review.reviewText: A quiet location near the Bay with a good restaurant next door. The only reason I gave the cleanliness a 4 rather than a 5 was the state of the carpet.

review.title: Good stay, fair price, no pool
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel for two nights, the room was clean upon arrival and the staff was friendly. We got a room on the bay side of the hotel, it was beautiful, the airport is right across the bay so we could watch the planes take off and land, the noise was not a bother. There are a few places to eat in the vicinity, the Mexican place was good, the Elephant Bar was not impressive. This hotel is close to the BART, which we used to get into San Francisco. Breakfast was served every morning until 10:00am, waffles, cereal, hard boiled eggs, oatmeal, yogurt and bagels/muffins. All the things needed for a morning start. I wish they had a pool, although there was not really a place for one...oh, well, good service and a good price. Oh, the beds are really hard...but if that is the only problem, its okay by me.

review.title: OK for a short stay
review.reviewText: The Vagabond was ideal for our purpose. We had booked for only one night as we had a very early flight home. In the end we booked an extra night as we wanted to see more of San Francisco. The hotel is quite modest by American standards but it was clean, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was nice and clean with fresh towels each day. There is no food apart from DIY Continental breakfast but the room had a fridge, microwave and coffee machine so if we'd wanted to we could have taken food in. There are restaurants right next door if you want a meal. We asked for an early call (4am) and received it. The main reason we chose the Vagabond was, apart from the price, because they have a free airport shuttle service and when we booked the extra day we were delighted to know that we could use the shuttle every day to and from the airport and then we were able to use the BART (subway), which has a station in the airport, right to Pier 39, which was all most convenient.

review.title: Stay away if you want to get sleep!
review.reviewText: Great location to the Airport, outside hallways very very noisy with kids running up and down the stairs and halls at all hours. The room it itself what ok for the price but the temperature in the room could not be change and did not have air condition. It was very very unpleasant sleep, you can't open the window because it faces the hallway. I would will sleep in the car next time if need be:(

review.title: Budget Hotel Airport
review.reviewText: Pretty much does what it says on the tin. A budget hotel so don't expect luxurious rooms/fittings but proximity to SFO airport makes hotel useful.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: Right by the airport. Also, the motel is right on the water, so running or walking can be kind of nice. The breakfast was not the same as a great cooked breakfast, but it was okay. Way more than just flour and sugar products. The real selling points were the price and the convenience.

review.title: Nice decent hotel for the price
review.reviewText: The staff was overall nice and helpful. The hotel was clean and almost everything was in good condition. The remote control of the TV broke on the second day. One thing that bothered me was the lack of towels in the room. I've been to other hotels and they always stack plenty of towels. This was my main gripe.

review.title: Perfect for a nights stay
review.reviewText: Nice view, hard bed, clean.

review.title: Look elsewhere
review.reviewText: This is a bare-bones clean hotel. The fact that you can't adjust whether you have air conditioning or heat is appalling. The first night we couldn't get a breeze in our room and could not sleep due to the heat. Although the outside temp was a nice breezy 60 our room was well above 80. The lobby could not do anything for me. Please sleep elsewhere!

review.title: Good hotel as a last resort
review.reviewText: The hotel is good overall. The major issue we had was that the air condition only works if the outside temperature is above 63%. The night we were there in July the temperature was such that the temperature threshold was not met for the A/C to function. The room was way too hot and resulted in one of the most uncomfortable nights I can recall and that says much being that I am from central Texas! Other than the A/C issue the motel is good. Breakfast is decent, good wireless internet service, complimentary desktop available, good, convenient and safe location, etc. If you're in a pinch and dont' have other choices or are on a tight budget then the Vagabond is your place.

review.title: visit again
review.reviewText: very clean, comfortable

review.title: Great for the price
review.reviewText: Hotel is close by to the airport, but u never hear any noice from the airplane, nice board walk behind it, great for a walk after dinner. room was nice and clean, free wireless internet, breakfast included. what else can u ask for ??

review.title: ALWAYS the place we choose to stay!
review.reviewText: Its such a clean friendly and accomidating hotel. The breakfast is great, and 24 hr internet works for me!

review.title: Not Impressed At All!
review.reviewText: No air can come into rooms; clerk said turn off the fan and "hope for the best"; carpet was old and dirty, room cramped. Noisy anytime wind blew and it is right on the water; it blew a lot! They wouldn't change my room; 4 star hotel down the road was only $2/more; when I looked it up on Expedia to make my reservation, that wasn't the case at the time. Nice restaurant next door; I wouldn't stay there ever again.

review.title: Solid
review.reviewText: Hotel is close to airport. Shuttle takes you right there. Hotel is just fine, especially if you just need a place to sleep. Nothing spectacular.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Complained to the desk that the a.c. would only blow warm air. He said the outside temp. had to be up to a certain degree to have a.c. come on. He told us to open the window. I have never been in a hotel that had that kind of setup. The room was small and cramped. The continental breakfast was good. Better hotels in the area. I wouldn't stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Good Price - Good Value - Good location
review.reviewText: I really like this place. I am close to the air port with a free shuttle. Nice walk way on the bay. Two restaurants right next door. Very good value.

review.title: disappointed...
review.reviewText: Distance from airport is pretty good. But The room which I booked for my special guest was too bad in spite of extra money. So I asked them to chage the room. I told them that I can pay more. Because my guest was so important for me. But they denied. I did not expect "king's room" But it was too bad... just like old barn...

review.title: Good price.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the spacious room and good breakfast which included eggs and waffle.

review.title: Affordable clean hotel on seashore
review.reviewText: I am frequent guest to the hotel. I like its 5 minutes proximity to SFO.Hotel is on the seashore. I enjoy walking along the shore. Two good resaurants are in walking distance. Free breakfast and internet access are extra benefits. Price is reasonable. For an extra fee, you can get the rooms facing the sea.

review.title: Yes, and...
review.reviewText: The room is a great vslue, however the carpet is straight out of the 70's! replace it or be ready to ignore it. I'd stay stay here again, though.

review.title: Lovely View of the Bay
review.reviewText: What a wonderful place - economical, clean, quiet, a great view of the bay, a wonderful walkway along the water's edge, a couple of good restaurants right next door, and a good free breakfast - all very close to the airport.

review.title: great place to stay
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Vagabond Inn Burlinghame for 1 week and found it a very good choice. Location is very convenient, less than 10 min drive from San Francisco International airport and also just off the 101 highway. Very large shopping centre, Tanforan, close by as well as many shops along the El Camino Real. Hotel is nicely situated on the water's edge alongside a walking path, great for your fitness walk or jog. Room was clean,comfortable and quiet with very good bed. Staff gave very good service at all times and the breakfast(included in price) was convenient and good value. Several restaurants nearby and plenty of free parking. We recommend this hotel.

review.title: Friendly staff, fantastic beds!
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed one night at the Vagabond Inn near to San Francisco airport, and thought it was excellent value for money. The room was a fair size, and spotlessly clean. There was a fridge and microwave too! The bed had THE most comfortable mattress I have ever slept on, and the shower was superb. If you're looking for a short stopover for the airport it's ideal, and has a good restaurant next door. We chose a room with a view of the bay, which was great because you see all the planes taking off and landing. Very pretty at night! Breakfast is self serve, with a waffle machine, cereal, fruit and yoghurts. Highly recommended.

review.title: Great airport hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel is in great location, room was very clean, quiet with very comfy bed. I booked room with view; view was terrific! Breakfast was great, shuttle pick up on time. Excellent service, very friendly staff. Will stay again.

review.title: dirty and falling apart
review.reviewText: hotel was a unmaintained mess

review.title: OK in terms of value
review.reviewText: Needs new carpet in the guestrooms

review.title: Better than Expected
review.reviewText: Other than the carpet (which could appear in a period film) I was delightfully surprised at how clean and comfortable this refurbished hotel is. Very nice stay, and quite reasonable compared to other housing in the area.

review.title: Business stop
review.reviewText: This is perfect for if you're there on business. It has everything you need, including internet access.

review.title: great stay and great breakfast
review.reviewText: My daughter and I had a great experience at this hotel. Our room and bathroom were very clean. We also had a refrigerator in our room, as well as a coffeemachine, blowdryer, iron and ironingboard. I had stayed in hotels before were not even half of that "stuff" was available in my room. I was extremly impressed. Breakfast was awesome. Not the typical continental - there were waffles, different cereals, toast,, bagels, eggs, yoghurt, pasteries variety of teas, juices,coffes.....
